pd93 (Thu, 15 Jun 2017 11:02:20 GMT):
@SurkaJang @KSLee As you can see by looking at the repository.. there is no active development here at the moment. A release for v1 is very unlikely any time soon. The latest version is compatible with the old *v0.6 architecture only*. GitHub Repo: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer JIRA: https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-6

first the version number, make sure the yaml files have version : "2.0"

MikeMayori (Mon, 28 Aug 2017 00:50:05 GMT):
try again executing the script

MikeMayori (Mon, 28 Aug 2017 00:52:08 GMT):
i thing the explorer is under development right now, i saw their road map 2 months ago , the state of this project is development , so it may have some errors

MikeMayori (Mon, 28 Aug 2017 00:53:01 GMT):
my advise is to wait until the team launches the version compatible with Hyperledger 1

MikeMayori (Mon, 28 Aug 2017 00:53:59 GMT):

MikeMayori (Mon, 28 Aug 2017 00:55:38 GMT):
after learning how this api's work and be familiar with the architecture you can try de play ground which will allow you to know better all the tools

@CodeReaper its looking for are new transaction events and new blocks .. so when a transaction is successful an event is fired and captured here irrespective of which node apps perform this transaction

Pardha (Tue, 10 Oct 2017 17:23:20 GMT):
@gstremote this seems to be a business level requirement. Your chaincode needs to keep track of some sort of identifier to maintain the audit trail for the asset. So far, blockchain explorer doesn't have this capability.

t_stephens67 (Thu, 12 Oct 2017 12:39:18 GMT):
@matanyahu whatever path you put as the "key" and "cert" gets appended to the current "blockchain-explorer" path so you need totake that "../first-network/crypto-config" and put it inside the blockchain-explorer folder

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:32:12 GMT):
Guys, i have one more question. i want to modify `blockchain-explorer/explorer_client/js/index.js`. but i should generate `index-gen.js` to reflect my change.

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:32:55 GMT):
i try to generate by executing `npm run build` in explorer_client directory.

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:33:01 GMT):
but the below error is occured

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:33:30 GMT):
``` > fabric-explorer-client@1.0.0 build /home/echo/git/fintto_server/blockchain-explorer/explorer_client > webpack Hash: e9bd5cc3473f53e97d0f Version: webpack 1.15.0 Time: 2918ms Asset Size Chunks Chunk Names index-gen.js 3.13 MB 0 [emitted] main [0] multi main 40 bytes {0} [built] [275] ./js/widgets ^\.\/.*$ 663 bytes {0} [optional] [built] + 330 hidden modules ERROR in ./~/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js Module not found: Error: Cannot resolve module 'child_process' in /home/echo/git/fintto_server/blockchain-explorer/explorer_client/node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib @ ./~/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js 15:12-36 ```

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:47:02 GMT):
Ah! i found the reason (actually i don't know why)

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:47:30 GMT):
add the below options in `webpack.config.js`

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:47:36 GMT):
```js externals:[{ xmlhttprequest: '{XMLHttpRequest:XMLHttpRequest}' }] ```

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:47:36 GMT):
``` js externals:[{ xmlhttprequest: '{XMLHttpRequest:XMLHttpRequest}' }] ```

amazingguni (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:47:36 GMT):
``` externals:[{ xmlhttprequest: '{XMLHttpRequest:XMLHttpRequest}' }] ```

Looks like your node environment is corrupted

lclclc (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:48:14 GMT):

lclclc (Fri, 13 Oct 2017 09:48:34 GMT):

t_stephens67 (Tue, 17 Oct 2017 18:13:42 GMT):
@mascanc The interface will only show the default ones it is hardcoded. as for the admin enrollment failed change use the same username and password that you used to deploy the network

t_stephens67 (Tue, 17 Oct 2017 18:14:03 GMT):

vu3mmg (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 06:08:46 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

vu3mmg (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 06:09:31 GMT):
Could you please let me know the configuration changes I need to do to make blockchain explorer work with my custom network .

lclclc (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 06:40:59 GMT):
@vu3mmg You need to change the app/network-config.json and config.json

lclclc (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 06:41:41 GMT):
And you need to copy your custom network's msp's admin's keystore and signcert folder to explorer folder.

lclclc (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 06:42:02 GMT):
Then you can point your configuration to custom keystore and signcert.

vu3mmg (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 09:26:30 GMT):
@lclclc

vu3mmg (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 09:26:33 GMT):
Thank you

lclclc (Wed, 18 Oct 2017 09:45:47 GMT):
You are welcome

UtkarshSingh (Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:17:58 GMT):
How a Block is created and linked into the Blockchain, in Hyperledger Fabric ? In bitcoin, 1. A certain no. of txns constitute a Block [ Block => Block no. + Previous Block's Hash + Txns + x(sealing no., a puzzle need to solve in Minning process) In Minning,

UtkarshSingh (Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:41:01 GMT):
How a Block is created and linked into the Blockchain, in Hyperledger Fabric ? In bitcoin, 1. A fixed no. of txns constitute a Block [ Block => Block no. + Previous Block's Hash + Txns + x(sealing no., a puzzle need to solve in Minning process) 2. Minning is done to solve the puzzle , and to Seal the Block [ time taken : 10mins approx ] 3. After this, all peers verify the Sealed Block (i.e., Minning process) 4. This Sealed Block gets appended to the Blockchain In this way, Block Creation is done; Proof of Work Consensus Algorithm is applied; And finally, Block gets chained to the Blockchain How this works in Hyperledger Fabric ? [Note: I have gone through the Txn Flow of Hyperledger Fabric, but could not find these] [1-3]Block creation related 1. How a Block is created ? 2. Block has only 1 txn ? (if no, how we can use this in IOT then, where instant response is the need, i.e., highly efficient protocol) 3. Block has fixed no. of txns ? [4-6 related to Consensus Algo] 4. How Consensus Algorithm works (even at the time of malicious entities) 5. What if endorsers cheats? 6. What if 51% of the peers of a channel are malicious ? [7-8 Hashing & Sealing of Block] 7. Are we using similar Sealing of Blocks(Minning)? Solving puzzles or Simple Hashing is applied ?? 8. How efficient is Hyperledger Fabric, in terms of validating a brand new Transaction ? (from txn proposal to txn being appended to the Blockchain ) [Security] 9.As, Solving a puzzle in Bitcoin Blockchain is making the system Computationally-Secure, so that malicious parties(having <51% network's computational power) can't break it. How secure is Hyperledger Fabric ??

t_stephens67 (Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:58:36 GMT):
@UtkarshSingh look up the Kafka based ordering service for hyperledger fabric. The block size is determined by the rate of transactions to a max size or a batch timer. With this a block could have 1 txn or a size you specify (if the size isnt met by the batch timer the block wont be full)

t_stephens67 (Thu, 02 Nov 2017 15:01:31 GMT):
@UtkarshSingh Additionally bitcoin and etherium are both permission-less block chains meaning anyone can jump on and start. With hyper-ledger fabric the blockchain is permissioned so the peers will need to be verified before allowing them access to the blockchain. Look at hyperledger as more of a business solution rather than an open thing anyone can jump on.

naruto1982 (Mon, 06 Nov 2017 03:02:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=svCZsZpqCPLNZCWNo) @MadhavaReddy Hi, I met the same problem and it seems that a lot of developers face the same issue. In my opinion, you don't need change these 2 values. Because the document says you just need to change the values relevant to the mysql and network configuration.

pancake (Mon, 06 Nov 2017 05:45:19 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=dCZTAEWYMjaPhStqC) Could anyone give me some help about the error as below?

lclclc (Mon, 06 Nov 2017 05:58:04 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=yfJAyRgiexwH3uonb) @jjmiranda You are seeking in the wrong place. That folder is used to store the imported private/public key. The keystore and signcert folder is inside your network folder. If you are using sth like "first-network", you can just search "msp" in that folder, you will see keystore and signcert of an admin user in crypto-config folder, that is what you need to copy, also, you need to use "identity import" command to import them into that .composer-credentials folder.

Hi all ,I'm a beginner to this. I had installed blockchain explorer from https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer and my query is 1)My dashboard only showing peers so How to check the transactions and blocks ? 2)When followed this steps mysql DB is created with name - FabricExplorer is there any relation with dashboard peers and transactions ?

flash139 (Fri, 10 Nov 2017 06:15:05 GMT):
3)How to add new blocks and transactions to my dashboard ? please help me

jeevas (Fri, 10 Nov 2017 06:54:14 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=yYXf8vZJjhhga5aeL) @flash139 For transaction . you can execute the this command "docker exec -it cli bash" and invoke your peer chain code.

flash139 (Fri, 10 Nov 2017 07:44:44 GMT):
thankyou @jeevas Can u please elaborate this ..

jeevas (Fri, 10 Nov 2017 08:00:06 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=XJeJaEeboS5hsxvHN) @flash139 you can refer this link - https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_network.html and you will get more idea about Channel Configuration Transaction. based on that u can execute the CLI container and We need only pass in the channel identifier and name of the chaincode. u can get invoke command from your "cat scripts/script.sh" file and get invoke command change your channel name .

UtkarshSingh (Tue, 14 Nov 2017 16:45:33 GMT):
For all the beginners out there, like me. I would strongly recommend you all to go through a course, titled, Blockchain for Business - An Introduction to Hyperledger Technologies, on edX It will help you in building and visualizing the concepts.

satheeshk (Tue, 14 Nov 2017 16:58:03 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=3FRiQz9cNDX24a3f5) @MohammadObaid Connecting to a fabric network on AWS is not any different from connecting a locally, as long as the blockchain explorer nodejs backed-end can talk to fabric network via grpc then everything will work fine. Please make sure you update the network configuration network-config.json accordingly to point to right peer ip/port and crypto artifacts

glotov (Mon, 20 Nov 2017 10:44:49 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

glotov (Mon, 20 Nov 2017 11:30:33 GMT):
hi guys! I just noticed that "data_hash" of the current block is completely different from the "previous_hash" of the following block. Fabric images 1.0.1, errors in logs. Why may it be so?

glotov (Mon, 20 Nov 2017 11:30:33 GMT):
hi guys! I just noticed that "data_hash" of the current block is completely different from the "previous_hash" of the following block. Fabric images 1.0.1,no errors in logs. Why may it be so?

Shachindra (Mon, 20 Nov 2017 22:38:29 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

RocMax (Mon, 20 Nov 2017 23:13:36 GMT):
@glotov the data_hash is hash of transactions in this block , the previous_hash is hash of all data in previous block. Actually a block can not have its own hash in it, because before hash you need to know all data of the block include the hash.

marksta (Tue, 21 Nov 2017 09:02:43 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

glotov (Tue, 21 Nov 2017 10:26:48 GMT):
@RocMax , I agree with your reasoning. I meant that blockchain explorer should calculate and show the current_hash, so that people could clearly see the link between blocks.

sk (Wed, 29 Nov 2017 06:00:30 GMT):
@jfodale Yes, it was unable to communicate with CA. Solutions (1) Ensure you have all correct certificates in place or delete all and generate new certificates e.g. "crypt-config" & "artifacts" folders (2) Try with docker-compose-svt. Let me know if this solves your problem or not

jeevas (Thu, 30 Nov 2017 05:36:24 GMT):
@ankitkamra @xingstarx @vurumadla can you stop all docker container and delete all fabric images and try. follow below steps for delete containers and images docker stop $(docker ps -a -q) docker rm -f $(docker ps -a -q) rm -rf ./crypto-config/* rm -rf ~/.hfc* docker system prune -a after that follow the url https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer readme document.. it should work...

xingstarx (Thu, 30 Nov 2017 05:59:30 GMT):

mbharadwaj (Thu, 30 Nov 2017 17:47:25 GMT):
can blockchain-explorer be used to explore a business network that has been setup via composer? i have been able to run explorer locally, and make modifications to connect to my fabric etc. i do have a business network build via composer and see transactions there. i can't get this to be visible in explorer - what do i need to do (if it is possible)"

iamprem (Thu, 30 Nov 2017 21:53:36 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

mvaibhavshah (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 04:51:14 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

mvaibhavshah (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 04:54:06 GMT):
Need urgent help please....how to get the history of all the transactions like create asset, update asset, delete asset, transactions related to update etc from different registries sequentially. Want to simulate same as we see "All transactions" in PlayGround. In historian APIs it is just giving the transactionid but not the attributes. All other explorer APIs provides the information respective to specific repositories..But I need all transactions (different APIs) in one call....

jasoncys (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 05:22:38 GMT):
[The answer is yes. You need to update two files in the explorer directory: config.json and app/network-config.json. Be mindful of the location of the .pem and _sk files for "admin". Good luck.](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=aSsrQ5jvGGorKCqjZ) @mbharadwaj

AkhilBhavirisetty (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 07:47:31 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

AkhilBhavirisetty (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 09:22:08 GMT):
@jasoncys can you please elaborate, on how to use the existing fabric network created using hyperledger composer? What should be the channel name ? How can i check the existing channel using command line ?

mbharadwaj (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 14:08:13 GMT):
@jasoncys thank you. i did go through those config changes. i don't see the channel - or in other words my confusion is in line with @AkhilBhavirisetty question above - how do i define the channel name etc?

jasoncys (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 14:17:40 GMT):
[ ] In config.json, change the "channelsList" to ["composerchannel"] or the channel name you created using composer, and set "enableTls":false. In app/networkconfig.json, update "admin" {"key": "keystore", "cert": "signcerts"} and copy those two folders to the explorer working path. Hope it helps. (https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=8rzno39AhcSky7AzK) @mbharadwaj

mbharadwaj (Fri, 01 Dec 2017 14:35:48 GMT):
@jasoncys - will try that out and cross check with what i did. thank you!

Has joined the channel.

Arghyachakroborty (Fri, 15 Dec 2017 18:38:18 GMT):
Hi... I am new to the whole Blockchain thing.. and currently trying my hands on "Hyperledger Fabric". I have installed it in my own Amazon EC2 server (Ubuntu 16.x). I have come to know about "hyperledger Explorer" , which is supposed to provide a nice UI for the underlying blockchain. The only problem I have is : how to open "Hyperledger Fabric Explorer" from outside the linux box ? All the examples / videos I have come across so far opens the UI in localhost. But, I can not do the same (or not willing to). If I want to access the UI from my laptop (say), what steps I need to follow ? Any help will be much appreciated ..

formax (Fri, 15 Dec 2017 21:05:07 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

DRSK (Sat, 16 Dec 2017 10:15:48 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

DRSK (Sat, 16 Dec 2017 10:20:05 GMT):
@Arghyachakroborty Make the port in which it is running open, to the network your laptop is in. Then try ip_of_EC2_Instance:port_no from browser in your system. I am also relatively new to this. This is how I solved my issue when i got stuck.

Dpkkmr (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 12:58:33 GMT):
Hi, I think we need to modify byfn.sh script line no.32 to point to correct bin folder. Modified code: export PATH=${PWD}/bin:${PWD}:$PATH Earlier Code: export PATH=${PWD}/../bin:${PWD}:$PATH

tkuhrt (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 17:59:27 GMT):
@muasif80 : All Hyperledger code is open source. You can download the code and modify it. Hyperledger Explorer is in Gerrit at: https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/admin/projects/blockchain-explorer

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:00:24 GMT):
Yes thanks i m right now working on that.

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:00:51 GMT):
Its using webpack which i have not used before so learning it. Thanks

tkuhrt (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:02:14 GMT):
Cool! If there is anything that you would like to contribute back, I know the community would appreciate your pull requests.

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:02:39 GMT):
Ok I will.

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:12:39 GMT):
You need to run the following commands

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:12:49 GMT):
in the blockchain-explorer/js directory

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:12:58 GMT):
npm install webpack -q

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:12:58 GMT):
npm install webpack -g

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:13:25 GMT):
webpack --config=webpack.config.js

muasif80 (Mon, 18 Dec 2017 18:13:45 GMT):
It will build the UI and make available your UI changes

hanumankumar (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 06:18:55 GMT):

jeevas (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 07:56:07 GMT):
Hi, Just want to inform to all that we have merged the latest code in block chain explorer ( https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer ) . The new code has features that resolves all the reported issues. Please update with latest code to continue with hassle free coding :) .

DRSK (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 08:16:24 GMT):
Have anyone tried out the fabcar sample from hyperledger tutorial?

labcoinpoc (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 08:20:06 GMT):
is tls necessary required in new version of explorer ? cause there is no "enableTls" config anymore

labcoinpoc (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 08:20:06 GMT):
is tls required in new version of explorer ? cause there is no "enableTls" config anymore

jeevas (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 09:00:20 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=iviqEDHcQLXhdCzzx) @labcoinpoc The current configuration always enabled TLS true. however the configuration can be changed to point to a non-tls enable peer by modifying the protocol (`grpcs -> grpc`) and port (`7051->7050`) in the `config.json`

lautroy (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 11:19:18 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

lautroy (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 11:24:04 GMT):
@labcoinpoc it seems that tls is enabled in hard code, it is easy to switch in app/helper.js.

lautroy (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 11:24:09 GMT):

Clipboard - December 19, 2017 7:24 PM

ankitkamra (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 11:43:21 GMT):
just remove comment for if-else block and set property enableTls in config.json it should work

jeevas (Tue, 19 Dec 2017 12:43:07 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=spDmJohm3ZZ6dXv9P) @lautroy Thank you . we have removed the hard code value in helper class and it will get peer url directly from config json . based on the configuration can be changed to point to a non-tls enable peer by modifying the protocol (`grpcs -> grpc`) and port (`7051->7050`) in the `config.json

praveentalari (Fri, 05 Jan 2018 01:36:00 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=JoehQdHJ8XJTNxNF7) i forgot to update config.js with my mysql password. Now everything is working fine. my changes are ```1.create required folder structure for grpc node/extension_binary in blockchain-explorer/node_modules/grpc/src/ 2.update config.js with your mysql password.``` Thank you everyone.

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 07:08:29 GMT):
Hello Everyone... I was doing the lab assignment for Hyperledger Composer doing a sample tutorial-network business network and stumbling upon while doing the trnsaction wondering if anyone could help me understnad the issue.. i have been trying from past 1 hour trying different approach, but none of them are working this is my CTO * * My commodity trading network * namespace org.acme.biznet asset Commodity identified by tradingSymbol { o String tradingSymbol o String description o String mainExchange o Double quantity --> Trader owner } participant Trader identified by tradeId { o String tradeId o String firstName o String lastName } transaction Trade { --> Commodity commodity --> Trader newOwner } here;s my logic.js function tradeCommodity(trade) { trade.commodity.owner = trade.newOwner; return getAssetRegistry('org.acme.biznet.Commodity') .then(function (assetRegistry) { return assetRegistry.update(trade.commodity); }); } and here's ACL rule Default { description: "Allow all participants access to all resources" participant: "ANY" operation: ALL resource: "org.acme.biznet.*" action: ALLOW } rule SystemACL { description: "System ACL to permit all access" participant: "ANY" operation: ALL resource: "org.hyperledger.composer.system.**" action: ALLOW } using the REST server here's my Data Source for: Trader [ { "$class": "org.acme.biznet.Trader", "tradeId": "TID1", "firstname": "TID1", "lastname": "TID1" }, { "$class": "org.acme.biznet.Trader", "tradeId": "TID2", "firstname": "TID2", "lastname": "TID2" } ] here;s my data soruce for: Commodity { "$class": "org.acme.biznet.Commodity", "tradingSymbol": "Symbol1", "description": "Cypto Symbol1", "mainExchange": "Ex1", "Quantity": 24, "Owner": "TID1" } When issuing below trade, i'm gettign error { "$class": "org.acme.biznet.Trade", "commodity": "Symbol1", "newOwner": "TID2" } Error: chaincode error (status: 500, message: Error: Instance Symbol1 has a property named owner which is not declared in org.acme.biznet.Commodity) This looks like quite straight forward to me, but not sure what am I missing here...? Please help

aviralwal (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 13:18:06 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=vSRDhfmcyhgWaQK85) @anupamsinha15 ask composer related questions in #composer. This channel is for Blockchain-explorer.

aviralwal (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 13:24:48 GMT):
@anupamsinha15 in asset Commodity, have you checked the cases when defining the asset. It is case sensitive... the object is `Owner` but in asset Commodity, it is defined as `owner`

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 14:35:01 GMT):
@aviralwal thank you so much. I think that might be the problem. I have changed the cto file, but not sure how to re-deploy the business network

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 15:57:16 GMT):
my ACL is now giving error: permissions.acl

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 15:57:29 GMT):
[Composer] IllegalModelException: Failed to find namespace org.acme.biznet.*

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 17:36:57 GMT):
Finally.. got it resolved.. It was a long task to do.. had to tear down the fabric and then re-install and the re-deploy the bna

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 17:37:18 GMT):
and then not sure why ACL was giving error in VS editor

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 17:37:29 GMT):
but finally it worked.. it seems very clumsy

aviralwal (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 19:10:48 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=Z46sfHAYJppfyDXmY) @anupamsinha15 Goto `step 4` of this [tutorial](https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/tutorials/queries.html) to redeploy...

anupamsinha15 (Sun, 07 Jan 2018 19:21:53 GMT):

jeevas (Tue, 09 Jan 2018 04:57:06 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=rzy5rk8KHQRBRqZ3j) @ssoima don't comment inside the json.comments of the form //… or /*…*/ are not allowed in JSON.

I completely admire the ease with which this project easily setup. Kudos to the team. Filed it in JIRA BE-113

chave070 (Tue, 23 Jan 2018 21:33:36 GMT):

vkblue (Tue, 23 Jan 2018 21:34:24 GMT):
@chave070 Not yet, config.jso used to accept an array, but not any more....

chave070 (Tue, 23 Jan 2018 21:37:11 GMT):
@jeevas was the one who changed that feature from previous commits. Could you help @vkblue and I connect to multiple channels? BTW, thanks for replying vkblue.

chave070 (Tue, 23 Jan 2018 22:03:10 GMT):
jeevas

satheeshk (Wed, 24 Jan 2018 04:45:10 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=RXiJM7AJwNkzynJuW) @chave070 You dont need to specify all the channels in config.json. Just provide one that's available and the application should fetch other channel details from the fabric network

satheeshk (Wed, 24 Jan 2018 04:46:42 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=aqzfJGXeJDoxS7Btj) @harsha We are working on the roadmap for next release, and we should know soon. But I think this can be worked independently on the current release. So if there are any takers, patches are always welome.

harsha (Wed, 24 Jan 2018 04:49:44 GMT):
@satheeshk Given the integration of blockchain-explorer with cello, there are couple changes that got into cello and are breaking cello on non-x86 platform. I would want to take it up and provide relevant patch.

satheeshk (Wed, 24 Jan 2018 04:55:07 GMT):
Cello is integrated with explorer ?

harsha (Wed, 24 Jan 2018 06:45:55 GMT):

MohammadObaid (Fri, 09 Feb 2018 06:40:19 GMT):
@Brandon Your peer should be running on docker . try to change `127.0.0.1` with docker container ip

Brandon (Fri, 09 Feb 2018 06:54:52 GMT):
something like 192.168.0.5?

MohammadObaid (Fri, 09 Feb 2018 06:56:32 GMT):
Yes whatever is your conatiner ip. In mycase it is 172.16.... something . You can get container ip with this command `docker inspect container_id`

Brandon (Fri, 09 Feb 2018 06:58:24 GMT):
i will try thank u

vitiko (Mon, 19 Feb 2018 11:42:02 GMT):

imranfahad (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 06:41:08 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

amir169 (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 08:03:20 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

aviralwal (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 09:47:23 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=a34d4qgh9gviE6KSj) @RahulPadole Please check whether the certificate for the peer passed is the correct one. This error appears when the incorrect certificate is passed

aviralwal (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 09:50:18 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=Jd32GJLNtCAhunoEJ) @sravs in the `config.json`, check if you have used grpcs or grpc and that the peer certificate passed is the correct one. This error is either due to incorrect tls certificate passed or that there is no tls security in grpc. First check the certficate passed in tls. If that is correct then use `grpc` instead of `grpcs`

hammerstrike (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 14:12:39 GMT):
Hi, how to reset hyperledger explorer data ?

nfrunza (Tue, 20 Feb 2018 18:50:36 GMT):
@hammerstrike mysql -uroot -p < db/fabricexplorer.sql where root is your DB user for fabric

gen_el (Mon, 26 Feb 2018 18:32:30 GMT):
There is a bug in `./db/mysqlservice.js` **line 27** `var port = mysql.port?mysql.port:"3306";` should be **`var port = mysqlconfig.port?mysqlconfig.port:"3306";`**

gen_el (Mon, 26 Feb 2018 18:32:30 GMT):
There is a bug in `./db/mysqlservice.js` **line 27** `var port = mysql.port?mysql.port:"3306";` should be `var port = mysqlconfig.port?mysqlconfig.port:"3306";`

gen_el (Mon, 26 Feb 2018 18:32:30 GMT):
There is a bug in ./db/mysqlservice.js **line 27** `var port = mysql.port?mysql.port:"3306";` should be `var port = mysqlconfig.port?mysqlconfig.port:"3306";`

gen_el (Mon, 26 Feb 2018 18:32:30 GMT):
There is a bug in ./db/mysqlservice.js **line 27** `var port = mysql.port?mysql.port:"3306";` should be `var port = mysqlconfig.port?mysqlconfig.port:"3306";` . I was ignoring the new mysql port i specified in my `config.json`

gen_el (Mon, 26 Feb 2018 18:32:30 GMT):
There is a bug in ./db/mysqlservice.js **line 27** `var port = mysql.port?mysql.port:"3306";` should be `var port = mysqlconfig.port?mysqlconfig.port:"3306";` . It was ignoring the new mysql port i specified in my `config.json`

akshaynet (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 17:24:12 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

akshaynet (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 17:29:12 GMT):
As per the capabilities mentioned at - https://www.hyperledger.org/projects/explorer - through hyperledger-explorer we can view, invoke, deploy or query blocks, transactions and associated data, network information (name, status, list of nodes), chain codes and transaction families, as well as any other relevant information stored in the ledger. I have successfully installed the explorer following the instructions given at https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer. But I can see only view optoins for PEERS, BLOCKS, TRANSACTIONS, etc., but there is no option for deploy, query or invoke. Looking for help on this from the fellow members of this group.

grice_32 (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:06:09 GMT):
Has anyone deployed a composer network to Fabric and opened it up to Explorer?

nfrunza (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:20:13 GMT):
@akshaynet thank you for the findings, we will review and let you know

lucasdf (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:23:27 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=BRHkMJi6c94uabRYe) @akshaynet there were some APIs provided by Explorer in earlier versions that allowed invoking and querying chaincodes. These APIs were removed a few commits ago.

lucasdf (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:23:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=ohyadLPjjTWmw4RWW) @grice_32 yes!

nfrunza (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:24:31 GMT):
@lucasdf do you know approximate date when it has those capabilities?

lucasdf (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:27:49 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=R7vaiMSoYB4t3uRbq) @nfrunza those APIs were removed in this commit https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/commit/b8ac105c44ca678550bf365a765863a2f8ab83a7 .

nfrunza (Tue, 13 Mar 2018 19:29:48 GMT):
@lucasdf thank you for looking

alexdevassy (Wed, 14 Mar 2018 04:59:26 GMT):
what are these variables in config.json mean ? "GOPATH":"../artifacts", "keyValueStore":"/tmp/fabric-client-kvs",

ittomato (Wed, 14 Mar 2018 08:29:23 GMT):

微信截图_20180314162054.png

yopep (Wed, 14 Mar 2018 09:06:58 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

nfrunza (Wed, 14 Mar 2018 11:01:27 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=SKuxKhKwPXQdxg9Tj) @alexdevassy GOPATH is the GO language path for the fabric, keyValueStore is the location of the keys private and public to authenticate the client in this case the explorer

nfrunza (Wed, 14 Mar 2018 13:36:18 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=duugH9q8WG4LZ4wZq) @ittomato we do not store all the data in explorer now, but in the feature release we plan to, you can see more at the node sdk, https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-sdk-node

block.PNG

MasthanbeeShaik_123 (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 13:54:33 GMT):
In the data.png the data is displayed as numbers. can u please what exactly it measn

MasthanbeeShaik_123 (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 13:54:33 GMT):
In the data.png the data is displayed as numbers. can u please what exactly it means.

MasthanbeeShaik_123 (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 13:54:33 GMT):
In the data.png picture the data is displayed as numbers. can u please tell me what exactly it means.

kidrecursive (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 15:29:34 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 17:58:43 GMT):
That is the encrypted data, and is being encrypted before storing into the chaincode(smart contract)

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 17:58:43 GMT):
I need to verify

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:00:28 GMT):
The encryption key is not always shared it depends on the chanicode and parties on transaction

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:00:28 GMT):
need verification

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:01:20 GMT):
Take a look at the : http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/fabric_model.html#chaincode

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:02:40 GMT):
To further obfuscate the data, values within chaincode can be encrypted (in part or in total) using common cryptographic algorithms such as AES before sending transactions to the ordering service and appending blocks to the ledger. Once encrypted data has been written to the ledger, it can only be decrypted by a user in possession of the corresponding key that was used to generate the cipher text. For further details on chaincode encryption, see the Chaincode for Developers topic.

nfrunza (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:02:40 GMT):
need verification

blockgeek (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 18:31:53 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

Amir (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 23:41:39 GMT):
@nfrunza I think what is stated in ( http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/fabric_model.html#chaincode) is the privacy of the chaincode not the data on the blockchain. it seems what is actually written in the chain is the raw data. and the numbers from @MasthanbeeShaik_123 image seems an ascii code (I may be wrong but that is what it looks)

Amir (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 23:42:22 GMT):
if you change the numbers to char you will find this string "miracleseft-blockchain"

Amir (Thu, 15 Mar 2018 23:43:14 GMT):
@MasthanbeeShaik_123 did the string that you wrote to the chain include "miracleseft-blockchain" ?

vanitas92 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 08:46:24 GMT):
Hello everyone i found a bug when setting the postgreSQL database host different than localhost: ``` `const connectionString = 'postgres://' + pgconfig.username + ':' + pgconfig.passwd + '@localhost:' + pgconfig.port + '/' + pgconfig.database;` ```

vanitas92 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 08:47:39 GMT):
at app/db/pgservice.js

vanitas92 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 08:48:27 GMT):
it ignores the config.json pg host database

vanitas92 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 09:10:39 GMT):
it should be

vanitas92 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 09:11:23 GMT):
`const connectionString = 'postgres://' + pgconfig.username + ':' + pgconfig.passwd + '@' + pgconfig.host + ':' + pgconfig.port + '/' + pgconfig.database;`

dockeryounger (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 09:42:46 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

vchinoy (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 13:08:41 GMT):
@vanitas92 Thank you. We will fix this.

ayang99 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 16:08:40 GMT):
There is a dockerhub release here: https://hub.docker.com/r/yeasy/blockchain-explorer/ - but if you check the issue in github https://github.com/yeasy/docker-blockchain-explorer/issues, you'll see that the Docker container gets out of sync a lot and just doesn't work.

ayang99 (Thu, 29 Mar 2018 16:08:40 GMT):
@nmarcetic There is a dockerhub release here: https://hub.docker.com/r/yeasy/blockchain-explorer/ - but if you check the issue in github https://github.com/yeasy/docker-blockchain-explorer/issues, you'll see that the Docker container gets out of sync a lot and just doesn't work.

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 11:09:43 GMT):
Hey folks, is it possible to run explorer just with [fabriic-samples/chaincode-docker-devmode](https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-samples/tree/release-1.1/chaincode-docker-devmode) ? This docker-compose-simple.yaml works like a charm and its minimal fabric components set for [chaincode development according to documentation](http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.1/chaincode4ade.html#install-hyperledger-fabric-samples). It would be very useful to run explorer also (even out of docker-composition). So I am curious is it possible at all ?

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 11:11:56 GMT):
Looks like explorer is broken on master branch I am getting errors like `[2018-04-02 13:02:10.352] [ERROR] Query - Error: Missing userContext parameter ` Also I don't see how [explorer serve's the client code (e.g the UI) at all](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer). The client is separate from the app (express not serving the UI).

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 11:13:02 GMT):
I would really appreciate help :) Trying to to put explorer in docker-compose (running backend , UI and postgresql )

rajivgandhi2010 (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:43:11 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer i have configured and setup the environment by following the above url. I didn't get any errors when I setup. But, When I run "http://localhost:8080/" in browser I got the error Cannot GET /

rajivgandhi2010 (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:43:22 GMT):
can anyone pls help me on this?

rajivgandhi2010 (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:43:31 GMT):
Thanks in advance.

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:45:47 GMT):
@rajivgandhi2010 That's because nodejs app are not serving the UI at all.... I manually build the client app ``` cd client npm install npm run build ``` And add this in main.js at line 60 ``` app.get('/', function (req, res) { res.sendFile(path.join(__dirname, 'client/build', 'index.html')); }); ``` Now when you open the localhost:8080 UI will be served

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:46:09 GMT):
Even the documentation is not OK :) https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#build-hyperledger-explorer

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 12:49:46 GMT):
If you see the blank page on UI after loading, open the chrome console and check for errors , for example in my case I see `react-dom.production.min.js:164 TypeError: Cannot read property 'forEach' of undefined`

rajivgandhi2010 (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 13:05:19 GMT):
I'm getting "Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::8080" in log.log file

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 13:06:34 GMT):
@rajivgandhi2010 You have something that runs on port 8080 already

rajivgandhi2010 (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 13:07:08 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/blockchain-explorer?msg=TiJTqhMNm3aZ4HWeq) @nmarcetic Is there any way to change the port for this application?

nmarcetic (Mon, 02 Apr 2018 13:09:26 GMT):
Yes, [change config.json](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/config.json#L45) then [change proxy port on client](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/client/package.json#L45) and don't forget to rebuild the client ``` cd client npm install npm run build ```

FlorentinoSainz (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 15:35:23 GMT):
(just in case someone is using a network with only one peer)

FlorentinoSainz (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 15:45:35 GMT):
plus if using non-ssl, there's some code which reads the configuration and doesn't work if you dont include tls cert property of the node... (!!)

ayang99 (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 17:31:00 GMT):
@FlorentinoSainz That's super-helpful, thanks! I'll try it out later. What change did you need to make to the code? I am also only running a single peer.

ayang99 (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 19:18:57 GMT):
the GUI is browser-based: http://localhost:3000 usually. When I first started, I followed the steps here: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#running-hyperledger-explorer and got it working without having to "npm start".

ayang99 (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 19:59:03 GMT):
Also - what did you put for the tls_cert property? I get various errors with both an empty string, and a path to a cert from a different network

ayang99 (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 20:29:52 GMT):
ok - got a quick run-down from a ReactJS guy - running npm start in the client runs the front-end part in development mode. You get useful stack traces and error reporting in the browser. Building the Explorer in "production" mode requires you to do the "npm run build" in /client which will generate the static files that then get statically linked-to by the web-app part (the node main.js in the blockchain-explorer parent directory) - this hides any useful error messages

ayang99 (Thu, 05 Apr 2018 20:30:46 GMT):
so, if you make a change to any of the code under /client, then you will either need to do a "npm start" or "npm run build"

rajivgandhi2010 (Fri, 06 Apr 2018 08:54:04 GMT):

AaronD 7 (Mon, 09 Apr 2018 20:30:14 GMT):
I'm trying to run hyperledger explorer on the release-3 branch but I'm getting nothing but errors. I tried it on the master branch and I also have dozens of errors.

AaronD 7 (Mon, 09 Apr 2018 20:30:45 GMT):
`E0409 13:29:02.161282472 14179 ssl_transport_security.cc:979] Handshake failed with fatal error SSL_ERROR_SSL: error:1408F10B:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_RECORD:wrong version number.`

Nghiadt (Tue, 10 Apr 2018 03:26:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=qsowcgjJKiGcH8mr5) @navaneethaa hi you. I solved this problem. You need to run npm both in blockchain-explorer directory and client/ dir. Make sure you run correctly following this doc https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/tree/master. Then adding this codes to main.js file. `app.get('/', function (req, res) { res.sendFile(path.join(__dirname, 'client/build', 'index.html')); });`

Nghiadt (Tue, 10 Apr 2018 03:26:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=qsowcgjJKiGcH8mr5) @navaneethaa hi you. I solved this problem. ApoorvChandurkar (Thu, 12 Apr 2018 12:08:56 GMT):
@AaronD 7 Hi, I am having the same issue while trying to run explorer on my own fabric network with non-TLS mode. `E0409 13:29:02.161282472 14179 ssl_transport_security.cc:979] Handshake failed with fatal error SSL_ERROR_SSL: error:1408F10B:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_RECORD:wrong version number.` Can anyone suggest how to resolve this issue?

ApoorvChandurkar (Thu, 12 Apr 2018 12:08:56 GMT):

Preetam007 (Mon, 16 Apr 2018 10:10:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=JdKxbmhyojt3vA9fN) @MarvinBechtold Postgres installation procedure created a user account called postgres that is associated with the default Postgres role. In order to use Postgres, we can log into that account. Switch over to the postgres account on your server by typing: * sudo -i -u postgres

FlorentinoSainz (Mon, 16 Apr 2018 10:16:32 GMT):
@ayang99 sorry, I removed tls_cert property (im not secured) and then in "helper.js" in getOrgMapFromConfig there's a huge if that checks that tls_cert exists, I removed the condition in the if... (according to docs, if you don't have ssl, removing tls_cert is what you have to do)

nekia (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 01:35:39 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 01:57:16 GMT):
Hi I found a thing wired. I also detected the same issue with [this one](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=4CNz22FqpFPF8bji5). I could work around the issue that brower is not displaying anything by putting 'tls_cacerts' in config.json even though my fabric 1.1 environment is non-TLS. I just reported about it [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49853848/hyperledger-explorer-is-empty-with-query-error-no-identity-has-been-assigned). Is that reasonable?

howdyeyey (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 02:07:29 GMT):
@bh4rtp thanks, found a trace in `reactbranch`.

nfrunza (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 02:51:43 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=et4rNuscydZ2wvwKQ) @howdyeyey Correct is Hyperledger explorer

howdyeyey (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 03:37:43 GMT):
@nfrunza thanks for the clarification

FlorentinoSainz (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 07:41:09 GMT):
@nekia there's a bug in the code yes, any peer without tls_cacerts gets ignored

FlorentinoSainz (Mon, 23 Apr 2018 07:41:45 GMT):
I removed that check in an if and everything worked (looked like no issues, but idk, I don't know the code)

MohammadObaid (Thu, 26 Apr 2018 19:29:21 GMT):
Hey @jeevas and others. I have deployed hyperledger explorer on aws ubuntu instance . After then I port forward 8080 on aws security group but when I view url with 8080 port it shows me 'cannot get ' . Any solution ?

satheeshk (Fri, 27 Apr 2018 11:35:43 GMT):
Hi @MohammadObaid Please use the template provided by AWS, it has all the required Orgs and peers setup with Hyperledger Explorer working out of the box. Please try this and let us know https://aws.amazon.com/blockchain/templates/getting-started/

satheeshk (Fri, 27 Apr 2018 11:44:02 GMT):
When creating the IAM role, it requires two privileges 1) AmazonS3FullAccess 2) AmazonEC2ContainerRegistryFullAccess

vanitas92 (Sun, 06 May 2018 20:43:19 GMT):
Hello everyone, I have deployed the newest version of hyperledger-explorer but i have an issue. My network has 4 channels and the app displays them all in the dropdown, though not all dropdown is visible. Nevertheless, when i click on another channel, the dashboard does not seem to refresh the data to the new channel. I still keep the old version before the change of the ui and it works correctly. Is this an aware issue or it justs happens to me?

mengluo668 (Mon, 07 May 2018 01:41:39 GMT):
@vanitas92 you have to bind channels dropdown event to redux action dispatch. The dispatched actions It will load the data of new channel from api and save return data into redux store. As I remember, you can find out the demo of `how to map dispatch to state` in explorer source code

header340 (Tue, 15 May 2018 17:53:35 GMT):

I also changed the nodejs version to 6.9.5 per the readme dependencies section but get the same results. The log file shows no errors despite a blank page coming up. rthatcher (Thu, 17 May 2018 16:12:48 GMT):

Clipboard - May 17, 2018 5:12 PM

vchinoy (Thu, 17 May 2018 18:36:02 GMT):
@header340 ok so if you are hitting http://localhost:8080 correctly, the error (Cannot read property 'foreach' in headerview.js) suggests the channel list is empty. And without a channel name, the app cannot fetch any data and hence the white screen. If the API call to get counts works, it cannot be a network connectivity issue, check config.json as for initial setup explorer reads from config file. Also Is your explorer code from release-3.1 branch or release-3.2 branch or master. If your network is fabric version 1.1.0, you need release-3.2. If your fabric network is 1.0, explorer version 0.3.0 from master will work fine for you. If you originally had fabric 1.0 and want to migrate to 1.1.0, fabric provides an upgrade guide and then you can checkout explorer from release-3.2 branch and build. Besides that if you ran npm install in the blockchain-explorer directory and then again in client directory and ran 'npm run build' in client directory before starting up app, it should be good. What happens if instead of using the start script, you run 'node main.js' in the block-chain-explorer directory.

header340 (Thu, 17 May 2018 20:08:10 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=bpZPNvkEpA3eDuk8Y) @vchinoy I had been running release-3.1 per someone's comment from a few days ago that I saw when researching my issue. I just switched to release-3.2 and so far I'm seeing the same results. Your comment about the channel list being empty is intriguing, however. The config.json has the correct channel name but I did notice while logging into the PostgreSQL db and looking at the data within the tables, there is data within all the tables I would expect (Transactions, Peers, Chaincodes, Blocks, etc) but the Channel table is empty. The data within the Chaincodes and Peer table show the correct channel name listed. However, I do also notice in the Peer table that the Org an MSPID columns are empty. Not sure if that's relevant or not. I'm having trouble unweaving the architecture of both the main app as well as the web pages to figure out where the channel seems to get lost in translation. Stupid question but it isn't a requirement to create the channel through this app is it? My channel already exists and I'm expecting it to get picked up. I do see where the create channel functions save the channel name into the channel table but I haven't found yet where it saves it there if the channel already exists.

KellyCooper (Thu, 24 May 2018 15:29:41 GMT):
#training-and-education-wg includes volunteers available to edit, test and contribute to tutorials and learning materials. Feel free to post possible collaboration in the wg or @KellyCooper. We have many volunteers for beginning projects and some volunteers for advanced. One way we can support your efforts is as users/consumers to comment on clarity, strengths and gaps in your documentation/materials. Your request(s) will be viewed by the group every Monday and we can track/manage on our end. Thanks, Kelly

[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=M3kQMDJHAwnwdfRtB) @wangrangli Do you have this db schema? can you login to postgreSQL and check if you have fabricexplorer schema?

nfrunza (Thu, 31 May 2018 12:31:38 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=M3kQMDJHAwnwdfRtB) @wangrangli Do you have this db schema? can you login to postgreSQL and check if you have fabricexplorer schema? You have to update it, make sure you run Database setup Connect to PostgreSQL database. sudo -u postgres psql Run create database script. \i app/db/explorerpg.sql \i app/db/updatepg.sql Run db status commands. \l view created fabricexplorer database \d view created tables

ayang99 (Thu, 31 May 2018 18:44:58 GMT):
Hi All - a general question: when you develop on Ethereum, you are forced to store the barest minimum of data on the blockchain itself, the actual data gets stored off-chain somewhere like IPFS. This constraint is Ethereum-specific, but does that mean people are storing large payloads in Fabric blocks? Maybe not GB, but on the order of MB?

rthatcher (Mon, 25 Jun 2018 13:55:38 GMT):
I've seen a few questions previously here about getting the Explorer to work with Hyperledger Composer. I have just tested it with the "default development Fabric" from Composer and I have a working configuration. The details are available in a Stack Overflow Q/A: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51020162/how-to-integrate-hyperledger-composer-business-network-with-hyperledger-explorer/51025119#51025119

nfrunza (Mon, 25 Jun 2018 13:59:30 GMT):
this is great, thank you

rthatcher (Mon, 25 Jun 2018 14:02:01 GMT):
I just edited the post because the Build instructions didn't works exactly for me

nfrunza (Mon, 25 Jun 2018 14:02:21 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=yMJpjRJubN32RqAgs) @SeamonJia We will setup a meeting with you and go over, and assign tasks

[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Rf9vhEu3nhKTFPsXX) @rthatcher Can you elaborate on the instructions you found ?

rthatcher (Mon, 25 Jun 2018 14:08:23 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=EuzJrrXvWM6woLJCm) @nfrunza - sure - on this readme page: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/README.md There are 9 commands to "Build Hyperledger Explorer" - the 3rd command `npm run test` failed for me with errors about log4js. I changed up one directory and ran `npm install` (in the app folder) and then back into test and the `npm run test` succeeded.

eugene-babichenko (Wed, 27 Jun 2018 13:07:26 GMT):
Hello, Explorer team, I saw your project and came up with a couple of questions. First of all, I have seen a message in your mailing list about making your explorer compatible with Sawtooth. Is there any progress in this direction? My motivation for this question is that we had to create a blockchain explorer for our Sawtooth-based project. Another question: can your explorer be extended with custom views for user-defined transaction types?

nfrunza (Wed, 27 Jun 2018 18:20:11 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=eTHyRM8yAyySx4wCz) @eugene-babichenko Can't comment on Sawtooth, can you elaborate on "custom views for user-defined transaction types" ? Any contribution to the project is welcomed

eugene-babichenko (Thu, 28 Jun 2018 07:53:52 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=3vbnE2ciJjJWbG8HD) @nfrunza I mean something like that: 1) We have our transaction processor which accepts some payload 2) We want to parse that payload and display the result

eugene-babichenko (Thu, 28 Jun 2018 14:08:01 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Sp88mXC7iAwDLi9gL) @nfrunza In Sawtooth we have a transaction right in the transaction header, for example. Not sure how it works in Fabric.

eugene-babichenko (Thu, 28 Jun 2018 14:08:01 GMT):

organization2 0 [] [] {true true true} 9 false}] ```

RealDeanZhao (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:21:26 GMT):
@vanitas92 I met the same issue before. You can try to modify the updatepg.sql file your self and make these columns longer and then re-setup the database

RealDeanZhao (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:22:15 GMT):
``` ALTER TABLE Transaction ADD COLUMN validation_code character varying(50) DEFAULT NULL, ADD COLUMN envelope_signature character varying(2000) DEFAULT NULL, ADD COLUMN payload_extension character varying(2000) DEFAULT NULL, ADD COLUMN creator_id_bytes character varying(2000) DEFAULT NULL, ADD COLUMN creator_nonce character varying(2000) DEFAULT NULL, ```

RealDeanZhao (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:23:31 GMT):
I made all the columns with the length 2000

vanitas92 (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:24:26 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=ZHAHAYpnB4z7pNH7w) @RealDeanZhao Thank you. I though the same and i was trying to figure out which column was by checking the logs of postgresql

vanitas92 (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:37:19 GMT):
I was thinking the reason of limiting the character types in these columns. A quick consult in the following official documentation link: [https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.0/static/datatype-character.html](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.0/static/datatype-character.html) says that if you do not specify the varying(n) then the database accepts strings of any size. Moreover, there is no performance issue.

RealDeanZhao (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:40:27 GMT):
@vanitas92 :thumbsup:

DenisDoronin (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:45:45 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

DenisDoronin (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 09:46:15 GMT):
Hi all! Could You please guide me? I've exported *.bna from the composer Launched it on local fabric using composer network install / composer network start command How to connect hyperledger explorer to the existing running network? I've followed guide on the github page but it requires editing config file which I don't have in my case. Thanks in advance

vanitas92 (Mon, 02 Jul 2018 10:15:58 GMT):
After putting no limit in varying in the sql script it worked perfectly. RealDeanZhao (Wed, 04 Jul 2018 05:30:43 GMT):
Hi All, is there any API to get all peers of the channel?? the explorer always shows the default peer of the default org..

RealDeanZhao (Wed, 04 Jul 2018 05:33:06 GMT):
``` async setChannels() { var client = this.getClientForOrg(configuration.getDefaultOrg()); var proxy = this.getDefaultProxy(); var channelInfo = await proxy.queryChannels(); channelInfo.channels.forEach(chan => { var channelName = chan.channel_id; let channel = client.newChannel(channelName); channel.addPeer(this.getDefaultPeer()); // this line should add the list of the channel peers, not the default peer this.setupOrderers(client,channel); var channel_event_hub = channel.newChannelEventHub(this.getDefaultPeer()); this.channels[channelName] = new FabricChannel( channelName, channel, channel_event_hub ); }); } ```

nfrunza (Thu, 05 Jul 2018 15:52:14 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=379Yc8E8GfwsAWfFb) @sasquatch85 We missed some updates in README, will address in the next couple of days

nfrunza (Thu, 05 Jul 2018 15:54:11 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=JKSQ3pH8hEqmAvDAq) @vanitas92 Yes, we are looking into this, please make sure you run updatepq.sql after every pull from the git

nfrunza (Thu, 05 Jul 2018 15:59:24 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=3sN6jSk6LZs8ZjnqB) @sasquatch85 Configuration "/platform/fabric/config.json" is only for the hyperledger fabric compatible networks, and the configuration app/persistance/postgreSQL/db/pgconfig.json is for the DB. If you switch networks and using the same DB config you will have all the networks data available for the explorer

nfrunza (Thu, 05 Jul 2018 16:28:48 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=b5nQxCXgQQCsKAYxh) @vanitas92 Please let us know: version of the fabric, branch of the explorer your are using

nfrunza (Wed, 11 Jul 2018 11:13:38 GMT):

krabradosty (Wed, 11 Jul 2018 11:24:47 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=RYrZaZHLpYxMtfWSe) @nfrunza How to specify channels? In config.json I see same entry: `"channel": "mychannel",`. I can specify an array here?

vanitas92 (Wed, 11 Jul 2018 11:59:28 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=s6CGgmTafL6JrkcxY) @krabradosty You only need to specify one channel that already exists in your network. The explorer should fetch all channels present in your blockchain

vchinoy (Wed, 11 Jul 2018 12:18:23 GMT):
@RealDeanZhao There is no point adding peers that we read off of config file. So the idea was to wait until network discovery is available. Fabric 1.2 offers the functionality so we will be able to fetch all peers for the given channel. We are close to providing a fabric 1.2 compatible version of explorer, stay tuned for updates on that.

nfrunza (Wed, 11 Jul 2018 12:19:42 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=SQQ2LjnLMnkF69j7S) @vanitas92 No need to specify channels, when you start HLExplorer and connect to your network fabric will broadcast genesis blocks of your fabric, including channels, chaincodes, etc

BlockchainBusiness (Sun, 22 Jul 2018 23:13:13 GMT):
GUYS!!! Whats the best starting point for implementing Hyperledger Explorer? The Github page is...not very helpful...any assistance would be greatly appreciated!!

BlockchainBusiness (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 00:21:38 GMT):
Hi all, in DESPERATE need of some help...Ive set up the Hyperledger Explorer as per the GitHub page...however when I navigate to localhost:8080 - I get a nothing!!! PLEASE HELP

BlockchainBusiness (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 00:33:21 GMT):
GUYS!!! SOME ONE IN THIS ROOM HAS THE ANSWER!!!

BlockchainBusiness (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 00:33:56 GMT):
:angry:

BlockchainBusiness (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 03:43:03 GMT):
Hi all just wanted to share a solution to a problem I was having....I followed the Hyperledger Tutorial here: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer I tried for many hours to get it working, but every time I would navigate to local host I would simply get a blank screen. To find out what the problem was I went to the logs folder and realised that the config.json file did not accurately reflect my directory structure....basically the file path was wrong! I fixed it and it worked. The reason Im sharing this is because Im sure there are many people who are beginners and perhaps need the help..

labcoinpoc (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 07:47:07 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=KzFhuni7i66gAK8cg) @nfrunza I did some test on this and added a commit to the Jira, maybe I found the reason, please check if it is correct, thanks!

labcoinpoc (Mon, 23 Jul 2018 07:47:07 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=KzFhuni7i66gAK8cg) @nfrunza I did some test on this and added a comment to the Jira, maybe I found the reason, please check if it is correct, thanks!

VadimInshakov (Tue, 24 Jul 2018 16:50:38 GMT):
Why explorer don't work with other node processes on machine? How to workaround it?

nfrunza (Tue, 24 Jul 2018 20:44:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=i9xuPSMBJGBJKD2uo) @VadimInshakov Can you describe your scenario ?

nfrunza (Tue, 24 Jul 2018 20:44:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=i9xuPSMBJGBJKD2uo) @VadimInshakov Can you describe your scenario ? fabric version you're using?

VadimInshakov (Tue, 24 Jul 2018 22:58:51 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=oHoC7GLAFQT65dmzM) @nfrunza https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/TROUBLESHOOT.md#background-information here it is written that one of the reasons for the problems with launching can be "Another node process is running". So, when I tried to start explorer on machine with Fabric (1.1), it didnt work. But when I configured explorer on separate vps, it's launched and now works fine.

nfrunza (Wed, 25 Jul 2018 01:20:49 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=J6o7BaqtQytWSBbRZ) @VadimInshakov Thank you for the feedback, and great that worked for you.

nfrunza (Wed, 25 Jul 2018 01:25:44 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=MR7YGPCajb6BmakoP) @praveentalari We have a jira for your suggestion, https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-415

VadimInshakov (Wed, 25 Jul 2018 08:57:19 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=jQLTgFzrAXFE6dE5T) @nfrunza But why so?

DrLana (Wed, 01 Aug 2018 13:17:06 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Tbd4n7RyQCFP25nXx) @nfrunza I discovered where the error is coming from. The connection with the Database is with the peer METHOD. I changed it inside the pg_hba.conf file and set the METHOD to md5. since then I can connect.

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 12:11:24 GMT):
Hi, is there any extra configuration required for running Explorer on Windows with Docker? I get following error when running `./deploy_explorer.sh dockerConfig` from git bash:

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 12:11:34 GMT):
`The command '/bin/sh -c cd $EXPLORER_APP_PATH && cd client && npm install && yarn build' returned a non-zero code: 1 Hyperledger Fabric network configuration file is located at /c/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/config.json Hyperledger Fabric network crypto material at /c/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/crypto Stopping previously deployed Hyperledger Fabric Explorer instance... Error response from daemon: No such container: blockchain-explorer Deploying Hyperledger Fabric Explorer container at 192.168.10.12 C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Resources\bin\docker.exe: Error response from daemon: Mount denied: The source path "C:/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/config.json;C" doesn't exist and is not known to Docker.`

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 12:11:34 GMT):
``` The command '/bin/sh -c cd $EXPLORER_APP_PATH && cd client && npm install && yarn build' returned a non-zero code: 1 Hyperledger Fabric network configuration file is located at /c/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/config.json Hyperledger Fabric network crypto material at /c/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/crypto Stopping previously deployed Hyperledger Fabric Explorer instance... Error response from daemon: No such container: blockchain-explorer Deploying Hyperledger Fabric Explorer container at 192.168.10.12 C:\Program Files\Docker\Docker\Resources\bin\docker.exe: Error response from daemon: Mount denied: The source path "C:/Git/website-request/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/examples/docker_config/config.json;C" doesn't exist and is not known to Docker. ```

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 12:15:43 GMT):
Drive C is shared, docker works fine from git bash, and _config.json_ file exists in the source path, I am missing something?

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 12:59:46 GMT):
OK got it

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:00:37 GMT):
This is because of Git Bash appending ";C" when converting Windows paths

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:01:24 GMT):
Adding a leading "/" before `$network_config_file` and `$network_crypto_base_path` in the _deploy_explorer.sh_ file did the trick

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:01:24 GMT):
Adding a leading "/" before `$network_config_file` and `$network_crypto_base_path` in the _deploy\_explorer.sh_ file did the trick

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:01:24 GMT):
Adding a leading "/" before `$network_config_file` and `$network_crypto_base_path` in the deploy_explorer.sh file did the trick

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:01:24 GMT):
Adding a leading "/" before `$network_config_file` and `$network_crypto_base_path` in the `deploy_explorer.sh` file did the trick

RockyRacer (Mon, 06 Aug 2018 13:01:48 GMT):
Credits : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50608301/docker-mounted-volume-adds-c-to-end-of-windows-path-when-translating-from-linux

RockyRacer (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 06:36:17 GMT):

nekia (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 06:56:57 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=jnp7XEW6aT5vWuRm6) @RockyRacer FYI. When I had the same message, the causes were as follows. * Removed 'tls_cacerts' entry of each peer ( It's mandatory even if you disabled TLS ) * Specified wrong protocl for peer URL ( I should specify grpcs, not grpc )

RockyRacer (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 07:09:34 GMT):
@nekia Thank you for the information

RockyRacer (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 07:09:40 GMT):
I have TLS enabled, tls_cacerts specified, and I use grpcs

RockyRacer (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 07:10:11 GMT):
I will look closer into my configuration

@RockyRacer if see troubleshoot.md file it clearly mentions this error is due to Fabric network being not identified by the explorer code. Hence if you check the configuration.js you would be able to see how it actually retrieves values from the config.json

nfrunza (Tue, 07 Aug 2018 11:15:30 GMT):

huxiangdong (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 00:19:56 GMT):

ShuaishuaiJing (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 04:12:50 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

RockyRacer (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 06:39:37 GMT):
@nfrunza I finally got it to work by : - removing network creation [deploy_explorer.sh] - replacing network name with the existing one running my fabric installation [deploy_explorer.sh] - removing `--ip` parameters when running db and explorer containers [deploy_explorer.sh] So all containers run in the same network, then I had to : - replace `db_ip` with the one got from the db container IP in the existing network (`docker network inspect mynetwork`) [deploy_explorer.sh] - replacing 127.0.0.1 by service name [config.json]

RockyRacer (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 06:39:37 GMT):
@nfrunza I finally got it to work by : - removing network creation [deploy_explorer.sh] - replacing network name with the existing one running my fabric installation [deploy_explorer.sh] - removing `--ip` parameters when running db and explorer containers [deploy_explorer.sh] This made all containers run in the same network, then I had to : - replace `db_ip` with the one got from the db container IP in the existing network (`docker network inspect mynetwork`) [deploy_explorer.sh] - replacing 127.0.0.1 by service name [config.json]

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 08:00:32 GMT):
Hm, ok, anyway. I am currently debugging the js and there is stuff in there that is never mentioned in any documentation, but I am getting somewhere. For example the info that the JSON-key for an organisation should start with "org" is never mentioned and just happens to be the case in the samples... Why? As well as the info that the peers must seemingly be numbered (starting with "peer1", which is assumed to be the default peer).

RockyRacer (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 08:17:11 GMT):

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 08:31:13 GMT):
Yeah, so for me it got resolved. For anyone with similar weird errors: Maybe try to understand what the files app/platform/fabric/{Platform,Configuration].js do. I personally spiked them with console.logs and the logs showed up in logs/console/console.log-[current date] @DrLana @KeerthiJ @rajanashutosh and anyone experiencing similar issues :-)

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 09:44:54 GMT):
Yeah, I am also confused by some stuff in the UI, but for me it's more of a proof-of-concept, so i generally don't worry about it to much. My assumption concerning the 1 peer and also in the network tab is only 1 peer listed is that in the Configuration.js (mentioned above) there is some handling of "defaultOrg" and a "defaultPeer" and I assume that the peer is just the default organisation's default peer. At least in my network that is the case. However all my peers's status is "running". So maybe you should check your peers. Are all the ports open (7051-7054 usually)?

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 09:44:54 GMT):
@rajanashutosh Yeah, I am also confused by some stuff in the UI, but for me it's more of a proof-of-concept, so i generally don't worry about it to much. My assumption concerning the 1 peer and also in the network tab is only 1 peer listed is that in the Configuration.js (mentioned above) there is some handling of "defaultOrg" and a "defaultPeer" and I assume that the peer is just the default organisation's default peer. At least in my network that is the case. However all my peers's status is "running". So maybe you should check your peers. Are all the ports open (7051-7054 usually)?

RockyRacer (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 13:11:26 GMT):
Do you also have hundreds of warning from your peer when Explorer is running ? `hyperledger_peer0.org1.example.com | 2018-08-08 13:07:39.840 UTC [server] validateStructure -> WARN 4e6 Request from 172.20.0.13:51660 is badly formed: +Envelope must have a Header`

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 13:51:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=LepgwecKD27o55f5s) @nfrunza For me it works as follows: Two Peers and one Orderer all running on different VMs. Explorer is running natively on the Orderer, while Fabric runs inside containers. The connection is done via the config.json (for the peers the endpoints are specified via grpcs://[hostname]:[port] and for the port the hostname is replaced by the ip 127.0.0.1).

iDix (Wed, 08 Aug 2018 13:51:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=KX4o9GyxG4YH3F4aM) @nfrunza No, these are correct. In the network tab there is only one peer for me

nfrunza (Mon, 13 Aug 2018 13:17:59 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=WN6J6efDqx3QPZWJc) @rajanashutosh we are computing it, see blockchain-explorer/app/explorer/rest/logical/utils/fileUtils.js, ar generateBlockHash = async function(header) { let headerAsn = asn.define('headerAsn', function() { this.seq().obj( this.key('Number').int(), this.key('PreviousHash').octstr(), this.key('DataHash').octstr() ); });

BarryMcLaughlin (Tue, 28 Aug 2018 10:01:13 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

BarryMcLaughlin (Tue, 28 Aug 2018 10:05:43 GMT):
Just a note for others having trouble getting explorer running under docker. It wasn't working for me and in the app.log was seeing this error: [2018-08-28 08:27:25.019] [ERROR] Query - TypeError: Cannot read property 'queryChannels' of undefined at Proxy.queryChannels (/opt/explorer/app/platform/fabric/Proxy.js:249:43) at Platform.setChannels (/opt/explorer/app/platform/fabric/Platform.js:194:35) at Platform.initialize (/opt/explorer/app/platform/fabric/Platform.js:155:16) at Function.build (/opt/explorer/app/platform/PlatformBuilder.js:11:22) at platformroutes (/opt/explorer/app/explorer/rest/platformroutes.js:14:36) at Explorer.initialize (/opt/explorer/app/explorer/Explorer.js:40:13) at at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:188:7) Some digging around the code, in configuration.js, found that it expects the org sections defined under network-config in config.json to contain the string "org". My original config, yielding above error, was similar to this: { "network-config": { "myCompany": { "name": "myCompany", "mspid": "myCompanyMSP", "peer1": ... changing config.json to look like the example below resolved the issue { "network-config": { "orgMyCompany": { "name": "myCompany", "mspid": "myCompanyMSP", "peer1": ...

nfrunza (Tue, 28 Aug 2018 12:06:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Jkn9fxNhxWMucPQhM) @WCamaly Your fabric network is running on another server?

nfrunza (Tue, 28 Aug 2018 12:06:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Jkn9fxNhxWMucPQhM) @WCamaly Your fabric network is running on another server? And is the network behind the proxy? Normally you would need to copy the the certs into some folder in the same machine explorer would run and configure config.json to the new folder you copied the certs

WCamaly (Tue, 28 Aug 2018 12:57:58 GMT):
yes, the Fabric network if it runs on another server. Is there a way to get it from frabric-ca?

blakem (Wed, 05 Sep 2018 13:56:00 GMT):
On a new image of Ubuntu 16.04 i was able to bring up my network, set up the database, and am able to see new blocks in the database for explorer. However, for some reason, the page fails to load past the loading screen. Could this be related to the error in the step "npm test -- -u --coverage" where it errors out regarding Landingpage.js?

blakem (Wed, 05 Sep 2018 14:26:53 GMT):
I finally figured out the issue so I thought I would share in case anyone else is having similar issues. My issue was that I could see transactions occurring in the database for explorer, however, upon trying to go to localhost:8080, it would stay on the loading page indefinitely. The issue ended up being that the channel name that I thought was correct in the config file was incorrect. Thanks again @nfrunza and anyone else that helped me with this issue and other troubleshooting areas.

nfrunza (Wed, 05 Sep 2018 14:46:20 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=3GMizmW9JnvZcyL6h) @blakem no

BarryMcLaughlin (Tue, 11 Sep 2018 14:33:14 GMT):
Experiencing same issue as @abityildiz - after trying to upgrade explorer from 0.3.5 to 0.3.6 - looking at code seems that the format of the config.json used to describe your network has completely changed (i.e. not the same as example shown in https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/tree/master/examples/net1) - am going to update to match format here https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/config.json) and see if that helps

nfrunza (Tue, 11 Sep 2018 14:42:05 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=nMWWWwjCjhkRfNBv9) @BarryMcLaughlin this was done to support new futures of the fabric 1.2, discovery etc

nfrunza (Fri, 14 Sep 2018 15:23:34 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=P9TRXcnPDaZCzctTj) @rajanashutosh sync process works independently with no UI, either you run one or the other

nfrunza (Fri, 14 Sep 2018 15:24:42 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=kJJfNCyWXjk5mF2eE) and node process is one per environment, if you try to run sync process with already running explorer, it will fail, kill node, by $pkill node

nfrunza (Fri, 14 Sep 2018 15:26:05 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=LvsZszXvzWxwSHTgp) @greg2git please make sure you have permission,

me_abhijeet (Tue, 18 Sep 2018 14:16:39 GMT):
i fixed it using : rm -rf /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/OpenSSL rm -rf /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pyOpenSSL-0.15.1.egg-info sudo pip install pyopenssl

nfrunza (Tue, 18 Sep 2018 14:32:45 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=7EfuAaykfKbNEAai9) @me_abhijeet thank you for sharing the solution

vanitas92 (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 11:11:11 GMT):
@BarryMcLaughlin If possible could you please explain how you achieved connecting explorer 3.6 with fabric 1.2 with https? I am using fabric ca but getting the error message : "Error : Failed to connect client peer, please check the configuration and peer status". Do you use the fabric-ca component? How did you configure the config.json? Thank you very much!!

DeepakMule (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 11:27:02 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

BarryMcLaughlin (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 11:27:50 GMT):
@vanitas92 Short answer...it took a while ;) Longer answer, we were moving from a 0.35 fabric 1.1 setup...and the key gotcha for me was that the config.json structure completely changed...so my advice is to go through that with a fine tooth comb and make sure all the mspids, keys, certs, urls, etc are exactly correct for YOUR network. No point in posting mine because its for out fabric network which is not standard. Use https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/config.json as a starting point...this is the correct format. As for how we achieved connection over https...we are running our network on kubenetes and used a TLS ingress. However, sounds to me like your issue is something not matching your network within the config.json - but I'm not an expert in this!

BarryMcLaughlin (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 11:27:50 GMT):
@vanitas92 Short answer...it took a while ;) Longer answer, we were moving from a 0.35 fabric 1.1 setup...and the key gotcha for me was that the config.json structure completely changed...so my advice is to go through that with a fine tooth comb and make sure all the mspids, keys, certs, urls, etc are exactly correct for YOUR network. No point in posting mine because its for our fabric network which is not standard. Use https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/config.json as a starting point...this is the correct format. As for how we achieved connection over https...we are running our network on kubenetes and used a TLS ingress. However, sounds to me like your issue is something not matching your network within the config.json - but I'm not an expert in this!

In my HLF network currently there are 3 ORG but those ORG are on remote instance and Hyperledger explorer is setup only on ORG1 only so can it be possible give only ORG1 and able see complete network information once explorer is running.

C0rWin (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 11:32:06 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

vanitas92 (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 12:49:17 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=jB3KSZqkKYEaiFhrr) @BarryMcLaughlin Thanks. I had a similar starting point and no problem until 3.6 and the restructure of config.json is a headache now. I still do not understand what is the meaning of the "clients" section of the json. Im using a completely customized fabric network running in kuberntes too and maybe with your help could get on with this! Thank you very much.

BarryMcLaughlin (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 14:07:56 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=guFA4nM8b5Bh6iFLo) @vanitas92 I'm also unclear on the "clients" section so if anyone on here has definitive answer please jump in. My guess is it is related to the NodeSDK client config see here :https://fabric-sdk-node.github.io/tutorial-network-config.html. The error you are seeing comes from here: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/FabricClient.js line 116. I also had this error at one point. Reading the code, the first thing it does with fabric client after initialization is call queryChannels and if that returns empty...you get this error. So, either there are no channels on your network or, more likely, the config is wrong somehow and its not able to connect. I would suggest this...take the url to the peer you are connecting to (the one matching organization in the clients section) then remote on to your explorer pod and try a cmd like this: nc -zv {{your_hostname_or_ip_from_url_property}} {{port_from_url}} If this doesn't return open then you have some sort of network issue or your config is wrong. Other things to check that the certs and keys in your config.json are actually there. Sorry can't be of more help but I'm no expert...just hacking my way.

vanitas92 (Fri, 21 Sep 2018 15:46:38 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=GfyLy6uihBGbBRxGN) @BarryMcLaughlin Thank you so much for your insights! Ill try your suggestions!
