nfrunza (Fri, 12 Apr 2019 16:28:25 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=zimEkALuXscTw3GxP) @MujtabaIdrees i think you need to enable discovery, explorer will pick up https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/discovery-overview.html

garunkumar450 (Sun, 14 Apr 2019 16:59:33 GMT):
@nfrunza ExplorerVersion:0.3.9 FabricVersion:1.4.0 location Remotely node Vesion:8.15.1

garunkumar450 (Sun, 14 Apr 2019 16:59:33 GMT):
@nfrunza ExplorerVersion:0.3.9 FabricVersion:1.4.0 location Remotely node Vesion:8.15.1 and synnctype is host in explorerconfig.json

nfrunza (Sun, 14 Apr 2019 22:08:12 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=pkiFiEqsAZWruT8SK) @garunkumar450 the problem is with permission, you may need to add to your remote fabric your pc ip, and use the remote .pem file under the copied crypto from the remote fabric, first make sure you can ssh to remote fabric from your pc

nfrunza (Sun, 14 Apr 2019 22:08:12 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=pkiFiEqsAZWruT8SK) @garunkumar450 the problem is with permission, you may need to add to your remote fabric your pc ip, and use the remote .pem file under the copied crypto from the remote fabric, first make sure you can ssh to remote fabric from your pc, and in your config point to the local crypto you copied from remote fabric

garunkumar450 (Mon, 15 Apr 2019 05:30:58 GMT):
@nfrunza i copied all cryptoconfig file in all nodes is same

nfrunza (Mon, 15 Apr 2019 14:12:41 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=YuiNpwi627Svwdoh6) @garunkumar450 is the remote fabric behind the proxy, or has a fabric-ca server configured?

javapriyan (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 02:39:58 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=Lr95bHmm6sZp2Nebm) @garunkumar450 @garunkumar450 if you are running locally, bring the "tlsEnable"to false and set all the urls to grpc from grpcs

akshaymayekar (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 14:01:01 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

akshaymayekar (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 14:01:45 GMT):
@greg2git did you solved this error,i am facing the same issue

Tommy109 (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 14:06:16 GMT):
when I run ./createdb.sh I get the error: 'psql: FATAL: role "root" does not exist'

Tommy109 (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 14:06:23 GMT):
how do i get around this?

nfrunza (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 14:28:25 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=wnkaZSeNTTDqAkWtK) @Tommy109 Ubuntu cd blockchain-explorer/app/persistence/fabric/postgreSQL/db sudo -u postgres ./createdb.sh MacOS cd blockchain-explorer/app/persistence/fabric/postgreSQL/db ./createdb.sh

Tommy109 (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 15:06:25 GMT):
@nfrunza thanks. works a treat

nfrunza (Tue, 16 Apr 2019 15:37:19 GMT):

nfrunza (Wed, 24 Apr 2019 05:08:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=whoZAHJzhdt7niXiZ) @RonaldReagan Hyperledger Explorer Version Fabric Version Supported NodeJS Version Supported v0.3.9.1 (Feb 28, 2019) v1.4 8.11.x v0.3.9 (Feb 7, 2019) v1.4 8.11.x v0.3.8 (Dec 13, 2018) v1.3 8.x.x v0.3.7 (Sep 21, 2018) v1.2 8.x.x v0.3.6.1 (Sep 21, 2018) v1.2 8.x.x v0.3.6 (Sep 6, 2018) v1.2 8.x.x v0.3.5.1 (Sep 21, 2018) v1.1 8.x.x v0.3.5 (Aug 24, 2018) v1.1 8.x.x v0.3.4 (Jul 13, 2018) v1.1 8.x.x

nfrunza (Wed, 24 Apr 2019 05:10:07 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=SbrRmoMMh6SaBJbWy) if your fabric network uses fabric-ca server, you need to TLSenable=false, and change grpcs to grpc in config json, also if open the connection for the explorer, add the ip address to you distributed proxy

nfrunza (Wed, 24 Apr 2019 05:10:07 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=SbrRmoMMh6SaBJbWy) if your fabric network uses fabric-ca server, you need to TLSenable=false, and change grpcs to grpc in config json, also open the connection for the explorer, add the ip address to you distributed proxy

``` { "network-configs": { "balancetransfer": { "name": "balance-transfer", "profile": "./connection-profile/config-balance-transfer.json" } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" } ```

raymondfx (Wed, 24 Apr 2019 18:01:08 GMT):

nfrunza (Wed, 24 Apr 2019 18:34:44 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=8QQsmx7rcv7RLTAXj) @gravity logs are located in logs/app/app.log, or logs/console, you may need to login into the docker , FYI From the docker ($docker exec -it sh) Install curl: $apk update && apk add curl Use curl in docker to query explorer REST API Example: $curl http://localhost:8080/api/channels Example response: {"status":200,"channels":["dockerchannel","mychannel"]

nfrunza (Thu, 25 Apr 2019 14:47:27 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=4WFkhn9WWxL9reFk7) @gravity If you are connecting to a non TLS fabric peer, please modify "network-id.clients.client-id.tlsEnable" (true->false) in config.json. Depending on this configuration, the application decides whether to go TLS or non TLS route.

gravity (Mon, 29 Apr 2019 15:11:32 GMT):
@nfrunza yep. I have similar config excepts this `command: ["sh" , "-c" , "/fabric/config/explorer/app/run.sh"]` for the explorer container. as I can see in the dockerfile for the explorer, it runs `node main.js` on startup. also, I have not `tlsCACerts` properties because in the non-tls environment, there is no `tls` directory in the peers MSP, hence there is no directory to point to

colasga (Fri, 03 May 2019 14:21:37 GMT):
all my 6 peers (2 per orgs) are defined as follow : peer1.org2.example.com: container_name: peer1.org2.example.com extends: file: peer-base.yaml service: peer-base environment: - CORE_PEER_ID=peer1.org2.example.com - CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=peer1.org2.example.com:7051 - CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT=peer1.org2.example.com:10051 - CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP=peer0.org2.example.com:9051 - CORE_PEER_LOCALMSPID=Org2MSP volumes: - /var/run/:/host/var/run/ - ../crypto-config/peerOrganizations/org2.example.com/peers/peer1.org2.example.com/msp:/etc/hyperledger/fabric/msp - ../crypto-config/peerOrganizations/org2.example.com/peers/peer1.org2.example.com/tls:/etc/hyperledger/fabric/tls - peer1.org2.example.com:/var/hyperledger/production ports: - 10051:7051 - 10053:7053

nekia (Mon, 06 May 2019 02:42:12 GMT):
You should specify the port number available within the docker network for CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP, it means 7051, not the mapped one (ex. 10051). @colasga

nfrunza (Fri, 17 May 2019 17:44:29 GMT):
for performance issues we keep in postgresql db

nfrunza (Fri, 17 May 2019 17:46:43 GMT):
please verify if you have installed db by running blockchain-explorer/app/persistence/fabric/postgreSQL/db/createdb.sh

circlespainter (Sat, 18 May 2019 07:34:40 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

lotty02cho (Tue, 21 May 2019 01:56:42 GMT):
@nfrunza Yeah, I have an error like below when I start `createdb.sh`. ``` $ ./createdb.sh Copying ENV variables into temp file... USER="hppoc" DATABASE="fabricexplorer" PASSWD='password' Executing SQL scripts... psql: FATAL: database "hyper" does not exist psql: FATAL: database "hyper" does not exist ``` so I use a command, `sudo -u postgres ./createdb.sh` and then it works. nfrunza (Tue, 28 May 2019 03:23:02 GMT):
please describe your fabric network, is a sample? your OS, which HLExplorer tag you use

nfrunza (Tue, 28 May 2019 03:24:40 GMT):
did you enable discovery service? see https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#60-fabric-network-setup---- , for: Make sure to set the environment variables CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT for each peer in the docker-compose.yaml file. These settings enable the Fabric discovery service, which is used by Hyperledger Explorer to discover the network topology.

SashaPESIC (Tue, 28 May 2019 18:36:17 GMT):
How do you setup the json configuration so that the explorer can see more than one channel? If there is org org1, and it is part of channels c1 and c2, how to specify both thannels in the configuration file so that that you could switch channels in the explorer UI. Every example in github is with one channel...

nfrunza (Tue, 28 May 2019 19:43:04 GMT):
please enable discovery service, see here https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#60-fabric-network-setup----

nfrunza (Tue, 28 May 2019 19:43:45 GMT):
Make sure to set the environment variables CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT for each peer in the docker-compose.yaml file. These settings enable the Fabric discovery service, which is used by Hyperledger Explorer to discover the network topology.

Ctype | Access privileges ----------------+----------+----------+-------------+-------------+----------------------- bc_db | postgres | UTF8 | en_US.UTF-8 | en_US.UTF-8 | fabricexplorer | postgres | petcoco (Thu, 30 May 2019 00:24:19 GMT):

nfrunza (Thu, 30 May 2019 02:07:11 GMT):
if postgresql is installed on an other machine, you may need to open ip of the explorer machine on the one where postgresql is installed

vanitas92 (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 13:50:49 GMT):
Hello guys, i am using versio 3.9.3 of explorer and i come up with this error, has anyone experience it? ``` false 'ssl-certs' '/blockchain-explorer/ssl-certs' postgres://hppoc:password@postgres-explorer:5432/fabricexplorer ******* Initialization started for hyperledger fabric platform ******, { 'first-network': { name: 'network', profile: './connection-profile/network.json' } } client_configs.name allianz client_configs.profile ./connection-profile/network.json FabricUtils.createFabricClient config.client.tlsEnable true FabricConfig, this.config.channels mychannel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.644Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel initializeChannelFromDiscover mychannel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.797Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.803Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.804Z - error: [Channel.js]: refresh - failed:Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Error : [ 'Invalid platform configuration, Please check the log' ] ``` Received kill signal, shutting down gracefully Closed out connections

vanitas92 (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 13:52:42 GMT):
Hello guys, i am using version 3.9.3 of explorer and i came up with this error, has anyone experience it? ``` false 'ssl-certs' '/blockchain-explorer/ssl-certs' postgres://hppoc:password@postgres-explorer:5432/fabricexplorer ******* Initialization started for hyperledger fabric platform ******, { 'first-network': { name: 'network', profile: './connection-profile/network.json' } } client_configs.name allianz client_configs.profile ./connection-profile/network.json FabricUtils.createFabricClient config.client.tlsEnable true FabricConfig, this.config.channels mychannel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.644Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel initializeChannelFromDiscover mychannel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.797Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.803Z - error: [Channel.js]: Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel 2019-06-04T13:46:19.804Z - error: [Channel.js]: refresh - failed:Error: Peer with name "peer0-oe1" not assigned to this channel <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Error : [ 'Invalid platform configuration, Please check the log' ] Received kill signal, shutting down gracefully Closed out connections ```

vanitas92 (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:12:37 GMT):
I am using the following configuration for discovering service, the bootstrap and externalendpoint they differ just to enable HA on both peers: ``` - name: CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT value: peer0-oe1:7051 - name: CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP value: peer1-oe1:7051 ```

nfrunza (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:24:33 GMT):
@here We need people to help on creating documentation for the HLExplorer, we want to use https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/intro/getting-started-with-sphinx.html , please any volunteer would be appreciated

nfrunza (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:28:52 GMT):
what is "HA" ?

vanitas92 (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:30:19 GMT):
High availability, in case one peer goes down, the bootstrap points to other peer to get the missed transactions when the peer was down

vanitas92 (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:30:45 GMT):
High availability, in case one peer goes down, the bootstrap points to other peer to get the missed transactions when the peer was down

nfrunza (Tue, 04 Jun 2019 14:36:02 GMT):
thank you for clarification

SatvikSabharwal (Wed, 05 Jun 2019 22:17:04 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

KristijanGlibo (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 08:48:18 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

KristijanGlibo (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 08:48:20 GMT):
Hi guys, @DavorKljajic and I created an article about Blockchain Explorer. In this article we used our custom network with 4 organisations, 1 channel, TLS, GOSSIP etc. We explained all errors and how we resolved them so maybe it could help to all of you having issues with it: https://medium.com/beyondi/understanding-hyperledger-explorer-setup-via-docker-6af845fcb82e

HLFPOC (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 09:40:03 GMT):
Hello, I have gone through the article and I am facing one strange issue in my setup, In my network, there are 2 channels, but my explorer only lists 1 channel in the dashboard drop down. As my fabric is running on v1.3, so I am using tag 0.3.8 of explorer, and have followed the instructions mentioned in its readme file, but not able to figure out why second channel is not visible although I am able to do transactions in that channel from an SDK app and have also configured service discovery variables in my peer container. Can you please suggest what can be the issue here ?

PrakashSelvaraj1 (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 09:41:17 GMT):
Hi, I had just created Jira (BE-661 & BE-662) requesting for new features. Please can you let me know how these are considered and included into the tool - any project plans (or) roadmap ?

KristijanGlibo (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 10:51:44 GMT):
On first what I could say is that you need to check your connection-profile file and define one more channel in channels properties (like we have bowchannel) where peer will be defined peer from peers property.

KristijanGlibo (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 10:52:12 GMT):
Maybe I am not 100% right because I don't have time to try that right now but based on what I see, that seems logic step to try.

HLFPOC (Thu, 06 Jun 2019 11:35:19 GMT):
I have gone through the readme file and it is mentioned that channel should automatically picked through service discovery , although I even tried mentioning my second channel in the connection-profile, but still it was not visible.

a good practice, do not run as root, as log you're not installing a package

periodic (Thu, 27 Jun 2019 10:25:01 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

periodic (Thu, 27 Jun 2019 10:51:51 GMT):
Hi everybody. I've tried to use explorer (its docker images), but faced with the connection problem after some time its activity. I've figured out that the problem is the following: explorer doesn't reconnect to db (postgreSQL) on losing connection. ```` db error { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } db error Error: Connection terminated unexpectedly at Connection.con.once (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:200:9) at Object.onceWrapper (events.js:313:30) at emitNone (events.js:106:13) at Connection.emit (events.js:208:7) at Socket. (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:76:10) at emitOne (events.js:116:13) at Socket.emit (events.js:211:7) at TCP._handle.close [as _onclose] (net.js:561:12) ... <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Error: This socket is closed at Socket._writeGeneric (net.js:733:18) at Socket._write (net.js:787:8) at doWrite (_stream_writable.js:396:12) at writeOrBuffer (_stream_writable.js:382:5) at Socket.Writable.write (_stream_writable.js:290:11) at Socket.write (net.js:711:40) at Connection.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:319:22) at Client.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:453:21) at PgService.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js:105:15) at Persist.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/Persist.js:71:18) db error Error: write after end at writeAfterEnd (_stream_writable.js:236:12) at Socket.Writable.write (_stream_writable.js:287:5) at Socket.write (net.js:711:40) at Connection.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:319:22) at Client.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:453:21) at PgService.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js:105:15) at Persist.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/Persist.js:71:18) at Explorer.close (/opt/explorer/app/Explorer.js:132:21) at server.close (/opt/explorer/main.js:153:12) at Server.close (net.js:1613:9) ```` I've added the patch and seems it works normal now on loosing db connection (crossed fingers) ;) ```` --- app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) diff --git a/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js b/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js index 8b49cae..d08de54 100644 --- a/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js +++ b/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js @@ -67,7 +67,7 @@ class PgService { try { this.client.on('error', err => { console.log('db error', err); - if (err.code === 'PROTOCOL_CONNECTION_LOST') { + if (err.code === 'PROTOCOL_CONNECTION_LOST' || err.code === 'EPIPE') { this.handleDisconnect(); } else { throw err; -- ````

nekia (Thu, 27 Jun 2019 13:07:11 GMT):
Nice contribution! Can you give us more detail to recreate the problem or raise a new JIRA? @periodic

periodic (Thu, 27 Jun 2019 13:26:10 GMT):
@nekia To reproduce it just stop explorer-db docker container (stop db) wait for connection error in explorer container and start explorer-db again. But it seems that some other error codes have to be supported (i.e. ECONNRESET). Anyway I'll try to create issue in JIRA...

nekia (Thu, 27 Jun 2019 14:21:42 GMT):
Thanks! If you have any unclear, please let us know. I'll also try to reproduce it.

ooojerryooo (Fri, 28 Jun 2019 02:58:02 GMT):
use raft ,The following problems occur`2019-06-28T02:57:46.065193464Z SyncPlatform initialize()-- @ Fri Jun 28 2019 2019-06-28T02:57:46.065425043Z 2019-06-28T02:57:46.065445040Z Sync process is started for the network : [first-network] and client : [firstnetwork] 2019-06-28T02:57:46.065817928Z config.client.tlsEnable true 2019-06-28T02:57:46.065921993Z FabricConfig, this.config.channels periodic (Mon, 01 Jul 2019 12:06:35 GMT):
Hi everybody. I've tried to use explorer (its docker images), but faced with the connection problem after some time its activity. I've figured out that the problem is the following: explorer doesn't reconnect to db (postgreSQL) on losing connection. ```` db error { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> { Error: read ECONNRESET at TCP.onread (net.js:622:25) errno: 'ECONNRESET', code: 'ECONNRESET', syscall: 'read' } db error Error: Connection terminated unexpectedly at Connection.con.once (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:200:9) at Object.onceWrapper (events.js:313:30) at emitNone (events.js:106:13) at Connection.emit (events.js:208:7) at Socket. (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:76:10) at emitOne (events.js:116:13) at Socket.emit (events.js:211:7) at TCP._handle.close [as _onclose] (net.js:561:12) ... <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<< Explorer Error >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Error: This socket is closed at Socket._writeGeneric (net.js:733:18) at Socket._write (net.js:787:8) at doWrite (_stream_writable.js:396:12) at writeOrBuffer (_stream_writable.js:382:5) at Socket.Writable.write (_stream_writable.js:290:11) at Socket.write (net.js:711:40) at Connection.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:319:22) at Client.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:453:21) at PgService.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js:105:15) at Persist.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/Persist.js:71:18) db error Error: write after end at writeAfterEnd (_stream_writable.js:236:12) at Socket.Writable.write (_stream_writable.js:287:5) at Socket.write (net.js:711:40) at Connection.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/connection.js:319:22) at Client.end (/opt/explorer/node_modules/pg/lib/client.js:453:21) at PgService.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js:105:15) at Persist.closeconnection (/opt/explorer/app/persistence/postgreSQL/Persist.js:71:18) at Explorer.close (/opt/explorer/app/Explorer.js:132:21) at server.close (/opt/explorer/main.js:153:12) at Server.close (net.js:1613:9) ```` I've added the patch and seems it works normal now on loosing db connection (crossed fingers) ;) ```` --- app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) diff --git a/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js b/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js index 8b49cae..d08de54 100644 --- a/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js +++ b/app/persistence/postgreSQL/PgService.js @@ -67,7 +67,7 @@ class PgService { try { this.client.on('error', err => { console.log('db error', err); - if (err.code === 'PROTOCOL_CONNECTION_LOST') { + if (err.code === 'PROTOCOL_CONNECTION_LOST' || err.code === 'EPIPE') { this.handleDisconnect(); } else { throw err; -- ````

periodic (Mon, 01 Jul 2019 12:13:11 GMT):
@vanitas92 Seem you are using scheme of network profile config (https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/connection-profile/first-network.json) instead of fabric platform config (https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/config.json)

nfrunza (Mon, 01 Jul 2019 12:41:14 GMT):
yes, we are using connection profile, with latest gateway of fabric-network

did you rebuild after $git pull? you can use $main.sh install from the root of the project

nfrunza (Mon, 01 Jul 2019 19:12:08 GMT):

FernandaSartori (Thu, 04 Jul 2019 12:10:41 GMT):
Hello everyone! Good Morning! I'm used to develop in Hyperledger Fabric, and in the last days, I'm started to read about Hyperledger Explorer and how to connect it to my Fabric application. In the "Getting started", I'm having a problem with ./createdb.sh. I already installed the prerequisites (Nodejs 8.12.0, PostgreSQL 11.3 and jq 1.6). But when I run the createdb.sh, a error is happening when a password is solicited to me for user "my_user" The error is: `psql: FATAL: password authentication failed for user "my_user".` When I run other commands usig "sudo ...", my password authentication works perfectly. Any thoughts about how I should proceed in this case? Thanks!

HLFPOC (Thu, 04 Jul 2019 18:04:29 GMT):
You might need to provide permissions to your db directory. From blockchain-explorer/app/persistence/fabric/postgreSQL run: `chmod -R 775 db/`

nfrunza (Mon, 08 Jul 2019 12:50:56 GMT):
@FernandaSartori did it solve your problem?

FernandaSartori (Mon, 08 Jul 2019 13:42:01 GMT):
Yes. That may work. In fact, my problem was referring to the postgres user. I installed postgres separately from the other requirements, and in the installation, a user for postgres was created in root of my computer with a random password. I delete this user that was created, delete the postgres installation and then install postgres using the homebrew.

nfrunza (Mon, 08 Jul 2019 13:48:37 GMT):
glad it worked

nekia (Wed, 10 Jul 2019 15:24:55 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=b54oKbrwe7CmgZfHx) @fsoares I think you need to add definition of TZ environment variable to your docker compose file. Ex. TZ='Asia/Kolkata' https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/TZ-Variable.html

delao (Wed, 10 Jul 2019 18:52:15 GMT):
FIXED: The problem was in the connection profile, I had to change those `localhost` in the urls to the names , like ca.example.com, peer0.org1.example.com and orderer.example.com

delao (Wed, 10 Jul 2019 18:52:15 GMT):
FIXED: The problem was in the connection profile, I had to change those `localhost` in the urls to the domains like ca.example.com, peer0.org1.example.com and orderer.example.com

nfrunza (Wed, 10 Jul 2019 19:09:52 GMT):
:thumbsup: great catch

nfrunza (Mon, 15 Jul 2019 12:41:36 GMT):
We use both gerrit and github, gerrit is for the review, and code approval

nfrunza (Mon, 15 Jul 2019 12:45:37 GMT):
admin user/password is used to connect to fabric-ca server, but if you're not using fabric-ca server, you do not need user/password

delao (Mon, 15 Jul 2019 13:07:09 GMT):
You can set a user/password before the home page of Explorer. This can be set on the connection profile under `client.adminUser` and `client.adminPassword`

nfrunza (Mon, 15 Jul 2019 13:07:49 GMT):
:thumbsup:

nfrunza (Mon, 15 Jul 2019 13:09:43 GMT):
Explorer will need to build a user/roles model for the authentication, there is not yet a design for that, if any of you would like to contribute with a design of such, we welcome you

nekia (Fri, 26 Jul 2019 12:04:47 GMT):

soumyanayak (Tue, 30 Jul 2019 11:30:13 GMT):

soumyanayak (Tue, 30 Jul 2019 12:19:27 GMT):
Can anybody provide a link or reference for the blockchain explorer set up in case of mutual TLS fabric network.

nekia (Wed, 31 Jul 2019 01:59:40 GMT):
https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-568?focusedCommentId=59526&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-59526

nekia (Wed, 31 Jul 2019 02:03:56 GMT):
If you have already completed the setup of your fabric network with enabling mutual TLS, you don't need any additional setup on blockchain explorer. fabric-sdk will handle it properly by using identity in your wallet. Before I've tried it on fabric-samples/first-network environment. Please refer the above comment in detail. @soumyanayak

nekia (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:15:12 GMT):
EAI_AGAIN means [A temporary failure in name resolution occurred](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-au/windows/win32/api/ws2tcpip/nf-ws2tcpip-getaddrinfo#return-value).

nekia (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:18:50 GMT):
As mentioned on the article ( and also README.md ), you need to align the network that explorer belongs to the one that fabric network belong.

nekia (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:20:15 GMT):
You should be able to see peer containers and explorer containers when inspecting the network ( `docker network inspect {network_name}` ).

soumyanayak (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:31:23 GMT):
Hi Nekia, in my fabric network set up the -- network_mode is used as "host". i havent specified any network name in any of the orderer or peer containers

soumyanayak (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:39:36 GMT):
so the same network_mode as host , i used in the explorer docker-compose.yaml file

nekia (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:54:08 GMT):
I'm not sure host network mode of docker, I guess the hostname is not resolved any more on your environment unless adding ip/hostname definitions on your host OS.

nekia (Fri, 02 Aug 2019 13:56:06 GMT):
For test purpose, if you change these host name to `127.0.0.1`, what's happened?

soumyanayak (Sun, 04 Aug 2019 05:36:25 GMT):

soumyanayak (Sun, 04 Aug 2019 05:38:33 GMT):
whereas when i am connecting from node sdk Gateway.js with the similar details and configuration in the connection.yaml file i am able to connect and carry out the operations from chaincode installed on peers...

nekia (Sun, 04 Aug 2019 11:08:43 GMT):
Your EAI_AGAIN error occurred on the connection between explorer container and explorer db container. So connection profile has nothing to do with this error.

nekia (Sun, 04 Aug 2019 11:13:49 GMT):
When using host network, both explorer and explorer db containers run as 127.0.0.1:8090( or :5432 ). I have never tried before, but I think you need to specify DB address with 127.0.0.1, not hostname(ex. explorerdb.example.com) in your docker-compose.yaml.

soumyanayak (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 05:33:41 GMT):
ok Nekia will try that and update you

soumyanayak (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 05:44:30 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:05:02 GMT):
That's great :thumbsup:

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:05:20 GMT):
https://fabric-sdk-node.github.io/release-1.4/module-fabric-network.Gateway.html#~GatewayOptions

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:06:16 GMT):
all you

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:06:16 GMT):
all you have to do is configuring clientTlsIdentity in

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:06:16 GMT):
all you have to do is configuring clientTlsIdentity in GatewayOptions when

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:06:16 GMT):
all you have to do is configuring clientTlsIdentity in GatewayOptions when calling gateway.connect(), I think.

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:10:32 GMT):
Please ask to fabric-sdk-node folks about the detail.

nekia (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 07:24:37 GMT):
In the current Explorer implementation, same identity is always used for GatewayOptions.identity and GatewayOptions.clientTlsIdentity.

soumyanayak (Mon, 05 Aug 2019 09:20:46 GMT):

nekia (Tue, 10 Sep 2019 00:00:57 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

nekia (Tue, 10 Sep 2019 00:08:07 GMT):
Currently our code base is on gerrit system. You can find how to commit your code to git repository via gerrit review system. You can login the system using LFID. Code base on github is mirrored (read only). It will be changed to use github directly soon, but I'm not sure when it'll happen. @rezabojnordi

nekia (Tue, 10 Sep 2019 00:08:07 GMT):
Currently our code base is on gerrit system. You can find how to commit your code to git repository via gerrit review system in the above document. You can login the system using LFID. Code base on github is mirrored (read only). It will be changed to use github directly soon, but I'm not sure when it'll happen. @rezabojnordi

nekia (Tue, 10 Sep 2019 00:45:49 GMT):
I guess you enabled authentication in your connection profile. It depends on your fabric-ca server configuration. But, unfortunately, as I mentioned [the post](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=5afb1af1-e408-490f-bc0b-3bebe6610d11) a few days ago, support of fabric ca is not fully implemented. There is still plenty of room be designed and implemented. Any contribution is welcome :slight_smile:

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 06:27:48 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 06:27:48 GMT):
Unfortunately, recent a few weeks, I didn't have much time to do any works for Explorer. But I seem to be able to have some time to handle one of them this coming week!

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 06:34:36 GMT):
Did you see tREADME.md]

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 06:34:36 GMT):
Did you see [README.md](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/README.md#60-fabric-network-setup----)? CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT are important because we're using discovery service to detect peers.

carlosalca (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 11:41:59 GMT):
Yeah I did so, but my Explorer still sees only one peer...

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 23:52:45 GMT):
What kind of fabric network are you using? fabric-samples/first-network or your own network?

nekia (Mon, 23 Sep 2019 23:54:27 GMT):
Anchor peer settings are also important for gossip (discovery service). If you are using first-network (byfn.sh), it does configure it by default.

carlosalca (Tue, 24 Sep 2019 05:15:04 GMT):
I'm using my own network

nekia (Tue, 24 Sep 2019 06:56:07 GMT):
By using discover cli, you can see whether discovery service is detecting all peers as expected or not. https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/discovery-cli.html

nekia (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 06:53:55 GMT):
release-4.0 branch is inactive. As I mentioned the last message, v0.3.9.5 (Sep 8, 2019) is the latest version. https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#10-release-notes----

madiazp (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:04:36 GMT):
@nekia Thanks. Just for you know.. I've changed to 3.9.5 but I've got the "Error: Failed to connect before the deadline URL:grpcs://localhost:7051"

madiazp (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:04:57 GMT):
The problem was the conf file

madiazp (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:06:30 GMT):
In the app/platform/fabric/connection-profile/first-network.json that come by default in the peers : {peer0.org1.example.com {}} key

madiazp (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 18:07:11 GMT):
have a "grpcsOptions" instead of "grpcOptions". I've changed it and it works fine.

nekia (Fri, 27 Sep 2019 21:47:43 GMT):
It's weird. There is no such a option for connection profile. https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/developapps/connectionprofile.html

madiazp (Sat, 28 Sep 2019 00:39:14 GMT):
@nekia Maybe is not explicit documented but you can see it in the sample at L146, L164 and L172

madiazp (Sat, 28 Sep 2019 00:41:47 GMT):

nekia (Thu, 03 Oct 2019 05:32:30 GMT):
I think, it's good option that you try to use explorer on first-network first. You need to check the following * You can see `Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::8080`. Is there any explorer that has already been running? * If first-network is running on the same machine on which you're trying to start explorer, you need to use `start.sh` or define `export DISCOVERY_AS_LOCALHOST=true` for mapping each URL of nodes to localhost. @lotty02cho

"peer1.org2.example.com"], "certificateAuthorities": ["ca.org2.example.com"], "fullpath": true, "adminPrivateKey": { "path": multiorgs-network.txt

soumyanayak (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 07:23:31 GMT):
try with this once

soumyanayak (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 07:24:02 GMT):
Make sure to set the environment variables CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT for each peer in the docker-compose.yaml file. These settings enable the Fabric discovery service, which is used by Hyperledger Explorer to discover the network topology.

soumyanayak (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 07:24:10 GMT):
Make sure to set the environment variables CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT for each peer in the docker-compose.yaml file. These settings enable the Fabric discovery service, which is used by Hyperledger Explorer to discover the network topology.

Psingh (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 08:19:10 GMT):
I have one more query. Can I setup a separate explorer for each organization? Right now anyone see the the txn of any Organization

Psingh (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 08:19:10 GMT):
I have one more query. Can I setup a separate explorer for each organization? Right now anyone can see the the txn of any Organization

soumyanayak (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 08:20:46 GMT):
@nekia any thoughts on this

nekia (Wed, 16 Oct 2019 23:37:02 GMT):
In the current explorer, you can see only txn related to the organization you specified in the connection profile. The txn generated on a channel which the organization doesn't belong will be invisible.

nekia (Thu, 17 Oct 2019 02:57:23 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=yr8F5doRKiYvrYZeG) @st Unfortunately, no.

nekia (Thu, 17 Oct 2019 02:57:23 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=yr8F5doRKiYvrYZeG) @st Unfortunately, no. Please ask it to #sawtooth

Psingh (Thu, 17 Oct 2019 05:05:24 GMT):
Got it. Thanks @nekia for the info.

hyperledger/fabric-peer:latest "peer node start" 28 minutes ago Up 28 minutes 0.0.0.0:7051->7051/tcp, 0.0.0.0:7053->7053/tcp peer0.org1.example.com After setting up, I got the following error, false 'ssl-certs' '/home/css/delete/blockchain-explorer/ssl-certs' Can some expert review my explorer here https://github.com/guru260/blockchain-explorer and point out my config mistake?

nekia (Fri, 01 Nov 2019 12:48:57 GMT):
The current explorer doesn't support fabric v1.2.* network. At least, I think you need to upgrade your network to v1.3 or higher version. We recommend you to use fabric v1.4.*. @selvaraman

selvaraman (Fri, 01 Nov 2019 15:01:10 GMT):
ok @nekia Thank you very much

TBigjohn (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 09:09:50 GMT):

TBigjohn (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 11:55:56 GMT):

carlosalca (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 13:25:16 GMT):
I have the last version available and that also appears on my deployment but I was told it doesn't work

nfrunza (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 20:35:32 GMT):
Register user works with fabric-ca configured network, and it should add the user to the network, try to configure with balance transfer sample to see it working, "Affiliation" can be found in your fabric-ca config, see here https://hyperledger-fabric-ca.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.4/serverconfig.html

nfrunza (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 20:37:15 GMT):
And the sad news are, that is is not fully implemented, we are very loa in resources, 1 man, please if you guys what to make any contribution, please do not hesitate to ask.

nfrunza (Tue, 05 Nov 2019 20:37:15 GMT):

rquera (Wed, 13 Nov 2019 15:41:09 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

rquera (Wed, 13 Nov 2019 15:41:10 GMT):
Hi all, I am discovering hyperledger-explorer and have some troubles understanding what it can achieve. Say I have a network with 2 orgs : org1 and org2 which are in a same channel. *I am part of org1*, and so have access to my org1 “adminPrivateKey” only which I put in the hyperledger-explorer connection-profile. If I deploy an hyperledger-explorer dashboard: - will I be able to see my ordering peer without hard-coding it in the connection-profile (I see my two peers thanks to gossiping, but I doesn't seem to exist a similar thing for the ordering peer)? - will I be able to see peers added by org2 ? - will I be able to see a newly created channel in which I’m in without modifying my connection-profile ?

rquera (Wed, 13 Nov 2019 15:41:10 GMT):

Hi all, I am discovering hyperledger-explorer and have some troubles understanding what it can achieve. Say I have a network with 2 orgs : org1 and org2 which are in a same channel. *I am part of org1*, and so have access to my org1 “adminPrivateKey” *only* (I don't have access to any of org2's keys) which I put in the hyperledger-explorer connection-profile. If I deploy an hyperledger-explorer dashboard: - will I be able to see my ordering peer without hard-coding it in the connection-profile (I see my two peers thanks to gossiping, but I doesn't seem to exist a similar thing for the ordering peer)? - will I be able to see peers added by org2 ? - will I be able to see a newly created channel in which I’m in without modifying my connection-profile ?

skyfan (Fri, 29 Nov 2019 09:45:50 GMT):
Hello there ! I am using HL Explorer in Docker and the log files under `logs/app` are filling very quicly, to the point that the log file of one day is over 5 GB. The log files are actually filled with the same `SyncServices - Block synch in process for >> first-network_mychannel` line, repeated many thousand times per second. I identified it comes from the `app/platform/fabric/sync/SyncService.js` file (here https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/platform/fabric/sync/SyncService.js#L350) with a call to logger.info(). As the logging level is not set in the file (using logger.setLevel) I don't think the level can be changed by passing an env variable. So I basically have two questions: - is it normal to have this function called so often that it prints the log many thousand times per second, or is there something wrong on my side? - is there a way to change the logging level, other than building my custom image with a `logger.setLevel` line added to the SyncService.js file? Thank you !

nfrunza (Sat, 30 Nov 2019 16:00:33 GMT):
i think we need to identify the value of the infor that is collected, and added to the logs, second, if that is really needed, maybe we should add within a time interval, let say every 1-3 minute print such info.

tengc (Thu, 05 Dec 2019 19:46:18 GMT):
Dumb question, but is there anyway to set names for peer nodes? I've deployed a Fabric network using IP addresses for most the address environmental variables instead of hostnames. In the network tab for the UI, the name of the peers end up being IP addresses. This becomes an issue if multiple peers have the same IP address, but are connected via different ports. Hoping there's parameter I can add to the docker compose files to resolve this.

nfrunza (Thu, 05 Dec 2019 21:38:26 GMT):
@tengc very good point, explorer doesn't have such ability, can you ask in https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/fabric-questions

metadata (Fri, 06 Dec 2019 04:30:15 GMT):
[ ](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/hyperledger-explorer?msg=6eHA3pAFcGp7Hnvb3) AFAIK u can't if the network is up and running. But if u are building from the scratch then u can add `1.2.3.4 peer0.org1.com ` in the `/etc/hosts` file. In the docker-compose we use `extra_hosts` that will create the same mapping in the container's `/etc/hosts` file. A silly answer is try `peer0.org1.com 1.2.3.4` in the `/etc/hosts` file. I never tried it and even not sure if it is going to work or either we can add this type of mapping in the `/etc/hosts` file.

nfrunza (Fri, 06 Dec 2019 05:44:30 GMT):
@metadata let me kow if it works

nfrunza (Mon, 09 Dec 2019 13:18:12 GMT):

herculan0 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:22:32 GMT):

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:25:28 GMT):

herculan0 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:34:48 GMT):

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:49:09 GMT):
@herculan0 did you build explorer? you can run from the root directory $./main.sh clean && ./main.sh install

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:49:44 GMT):
do you use a fabric sample or your custom fabric blockchain?

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:53:30 GMT):
what is you Nodejs version ?

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 18:56:12 GMT):
see here some solution https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/TROUBLESHOOT.md#problem-description--db-error--error-ident-authentication-failed-for-user-hppoc

herculan0 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 19:27:24 GMT):
dude i not think that is a proxy problem =(

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 20:50:32 GMT):
@herculan0 fixed it by following I fix it : https://serverfault.com/questions/406606/postgres-error-message-fatal-ident-authentication-failed-for-user There is no Ident server running on the machine you're trying to connect from. Test this by trying to connect to it on port 113. If that fails, install an Ident server (eg, sudo apt-get install oidentd). Maybe you actually want to connect with a password, not Ident. Edit the pg_hba.conf file host all all 127.0.0.1/32 ident to host all all 127.0.0.1/32 md5 and it works!

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 20:52:10 GMT):
@tengc unfortunately we don't have any

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:18:39 GMT):
I have multi-org and each org having 2 peer nodes in fabric setup . After setting up explorer I'm only able to see Org1 nodes not org2 node . Can anyone please help me on this

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:24:46 GMT):
you may need to set them as discoverable, please ask here https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/fabric-questions

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:29:58 GMT):
I have set CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT variables .. My issue is if I am passing "organization": "Org1" in connection-profile getting org1 peer nodes and in case I am passing "organization": "Org2" in connection-profile . getting org2 peer nodes .. But in anyways I am not getting all 4 peer nodes .Please help

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:31:18 GMT):
org need to communicate between each other

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:32:58 GMT):
the communication b/w orgs are working fine for Node js app connection profile and all transactions are in sync .

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:33:30 GMT):
let me send you the snapshot

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:34:19 GMT):
you have to add to all nodes the variable CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_BOOTSTRAP and CORE_PEER_GOSSIP_EXTERNALENDPOINT to the default node

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:34:40 GMT):

Explorer-1.png

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:35:21 GMT):
explorer receives whatever fabric is broadcasting

nfrunza (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:35:47 GMT):

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:39:35 GMT):
Do you have any sample docker-compose.yaml and connection-profile for multi orgs and multi node setup ?

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:39:53 GMT):
I am trying to setup explorer using docker

prakash04 (Tue, 10 Dec 2019 22:49:23 GMT):
can anyone please help me on this issue ?

nekia (Wed, 11 Dec 2019 07:30:25 GMT):
@prakash04 [12.2 Run Hyperledger Explorer Using Docker Compose](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#122-run-hyperledger-explorer-using-docker-compose----) You can follow the above step to run explorer using docker. [This connection-profile](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/examples/net1/connection-profile/first-network.json) works with fabric-samples/first-network that is multi orgs and multi node. You can use [this docker-compose.yaml](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/docker-compose.yaml) to run explorer with the first-network environment.

rquera (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:17:21 GMT):
Hello everyone, is it mandatory to specify a channel in the connection-profile ? Leaving the `"channels": {}` empty gives me a `Channel not found for name undefined` error.

nfrunza (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:29:28 GMT):
i see two connection profiles : "network-configs": { "organization-one": { "name": "organizationOne", "profile": "./connection-profile/organization-one.json" }, "organization-two": { "name": "organizationTwo", "profile": "./connection-profile/organization-two.json" } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" }

nfrunza (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:30:56 GMT):
default channel needs to use the discovery service , see https://fabric-sdk-node.github.io/tutorial-discovery.html

nfrunza (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:38:12 GMT):
default channel name is a must

rquera (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:56:02 GMT):

nfrunza (Tue, 17 Dec 2019 15:57:59 GMT):

nfrunza (Fri, 20 Dec 2019 15:55:39 GMT):
@chaitanya5 @nekia should be able to help you

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 00:16:26 GMT):
It's nothing to do with access to the postgres db. It's for https access of explorer itself.

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 00:25:02 GMT):
Can you see the database via psql cli? ``` $ sudo -u postgres psql -d fabricexplorer -c '\dt' List of relations Schema | Name | Type | Owner --------+--------------------+-------+------- public | blocks | table | hppoc public | chaincodes | table | hppoc public | channel | table | hppoc public | orderer | table | hppoc public | peer | table | hppoc public | peer_ref_chaincode | table | hppoc public | peer_ref_channel | table | hppoc public | transactions | table | hppoc public | write_lock | table | hppoc ```

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 00:28:54 GMT):
You need to do the following step. ``` This file contains the certificates and artefacts of the blockchain network that we want to put Hyperldger Explorer. In our case, we copied them from our blockchain network to examples/net1/keychain folder. ```

sanket1211 (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 09:05:26 GMT):
yes i can see

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 11:52:17 GMT):
Do you mean that you can see fabricexplorer database from the machine where you are trying to launch explorer to 132.145.70.5+5432 ?

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 11:52:17 GMT):
Do you mean that you can see fabricexplorer database from the machine where you are trying to launch explorer to 132.145.70.5:5432 ?

sanket1211 (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 11:53:00 GMT):
Yes

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 12:35:27 GMT):
Are you running postgreSQL DB on the machine where explorer is running? If so, please change postgreSQL host address to `127.0.0.1` in `app/explorerconfig.json`.

nekia (Sat, 21 Dec 2019 12:37:25 GMT):

Arrow 9 (Tue, 21 Jan 2020 07:21:30 GMT):

Arrow 9 (Tue, 21 Jan 2020 07:21:30 GMT):
@selvaraman as per security u cannot request from localhost ports. To do this u need to change few things in sawtooth explorer find server file where Express is initialized and add new package cors and use it ur problem will be solved

SimonOberzan (Tue, 28 Jan 2020 19:11:58 GMT):

SimonOberzan (Tue, 28 Jan 2020 19:51:57 GMT):
Hi! I am experiencing a strange behaviour. I have set the enableAuthentication to false in my connection-profile but the login page is still displayed. The weird thing is that no matter what credentials I enter I am successfully logged in as the server part knows to skip authentication but the client side is still displaying the login page... Does anyone know what might be the issue here?

SimonOberzan (Wed, 29 Jan 2020 18:21:01 GMT):
I have looked at the code and to me it seems that enableAuthenitcation: false is not really doing what I would expect it to. I can see that all /api/* routes are protected with the auth-check middleware which requires that the request have a valid JWT token, which is generated at login. Also if there is no token in the localStorage, the client will automatically redirect itself to /login. So am I missing something here or doesn't "enableAuthenitcation: false" work? If it works what is its functionality if not skipping the whole authenication process?

nekia (Thu, 30 Jan 2020 00:33:34 GMT):
@SimonOberzan Thank you for raising an issue. I could reproduce the issue on my local, too. I create a new JIRA https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-729

Always welcome your contribution. :thumbsup:

nekia (Sun, 23 Feb 2020 22:56:34 GMT):
You don't need to do any steps for client separately. Just run `./start.sh`. If you still have same message (`No process name...`), that means you have some issue in bootup of explorer.

woodyjon (Mon, 24 Feb 2020 13:36:59 GMT):
Hello. I am trying to install the explorer on a kubernetes cluster where I have a fabric v2 test networ running. For the connection config file of the explorer, here they say that the adminUser and adminPasswords are those of the Fabric CA: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer#70-configure-hyperledger-fabric . But I am using cryptogen and I don't think I have admin user and password for my network. Can you advise what to put in those adminUser and adminPasswords fields?

vanitas92 (Tue, 25 Feb 2020 09:07:17 GMT):
Hi @woodyjon , as far as i know, blockchain explorer does not support latest version and yoiu migh get this errors due to incompatibility of their app. The latest release supports until 1.4.4 as stated in their release section: https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/releases

woodyjon (Tue, 25 Feb 2020 09:12:49 GMT):
@vanitas92 on the Feb 18th, in this chat, someone said they installed it without any issue on a 2.0 network. That's why I thought it would be ok. But maybe I have another issue.

vanitas92 (Tue, 25 Feb 2020 09:15:35 GMT):
i wasn't aware of that, however, i would wait the developers to officially support it, as that user might have it working on a setting that you may not have and does not support.

woodyjon (Tue, 25 Feb 2020 09:16:01 GMT):
I don't fully understand the "tlsEnable" and use of "grpcs" in the explorer config file. My network uses TLS as I use raft orderer, but my peers have tls enable (CORE_PEER_TLS_ENABLED=true) but client tls disabled (CORE_PEER_TLS_CLIENTAUTHREQUIRED=false). So do I need to put "tlsEnable" at true in the explorer config, and go I need to use grpcs instead of grpc?

woodyjon (Tue, 25 Feb 2020 09:17:21 GMT):
yes you might be right about 2.0 support

nekia (Wed, 26 Feb 2020 22:41:57 GMT):
Yes, in that case, you need to set `true` to `tlsEnable` in your explorer configuration. But you don't need to take care about grpc prefix at peer URL. That should be adjusted automatically. @woodyjon

nekia (Wed, 26 Feb 2020 22:49:41 GMT):
In [hyperledger explorer](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer), fabric is supported (now we're working to support of iroha). I think you might be able to get some information at #sawtooth channel. @selvaraman

metadata (Thu, 27 Feb 2020 18:53:49 GMT):
hello @nekia for running the explorer in production what are the necessary changes in terms of config and security perspective that one should make to the explorer?

nekia (Thu, 27 Feb 2020 23:17:25 GMT):
OK, these steps are partially out of date.

nekia (Thu, 27 Feb 2020 23:19:55 GMT):
In `App Config`, you need to follow the current syntax that you can see in the original [config.json](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/v1.0.0-rc2/app/platform/fabric/config.json) and [connection profile](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/v1.0.0-rc2/app/platform/fabric/connection-profile/first-network.json).

nekia (Thu, 27 Feb 2020 23:22:06 GMT):
And you don't need the step `serve -s build`.

ok and thanks a lot

nekia (Sat, 29 Feb 2020 00:09:00 GMT):
It looks like to me that you are running Explorer in docker container. But the crypto files are still placed on your local file system. I think you need to mount these files on docker volume. @metadata

nekia (Sat, 29 Feb 2020 00:10:18 GMT):
I think it depends on your requirement in your service.

metadata (Sat, 29 Feb 2020 05:33:43 GMT):
@nekia I'm mounting the `crypto` dir. ``` volumes: - /home/delta/GoWorkspace/src/github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/app/platform/fabric/config.json:/opt/explorer/app/platform/fabric/config.json:ro - /home/delta/GoWorkspace/src/github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/app/platform/fabric/connection-profile:/opt/explorer/app/platform/fabric/connection-profile:ro - /home/delta/GoWorkspace/src/github.com/testchain/networks/crypto-config:/tmp/crypto:ro - walletstore:/opt/wallet ``` In `app/platform/fabric/connection-profile/mynetwork.json` file I've mentioned the local file system path. Is it correct?

metadata (Sat, 29 Feb 2020 07:01:18 GMT):
got it.

nekia (Sun, 01 Mar 2020 23:10:37 GMT):

nekia (Sun, 01 Mar 2020 23:48:12 GMT):
Which explorer images are you using? 1.0.0-rc2 on docker hub or your own image built from the latest master? The previous one doesn't have function to control logging via env variable yet.

metadata (Mon, 02 Mar 2020 05:27:48 GMT):
I'm using `1.0.0-rc2`.

metadata (Mon, 02 Mar 2020 06:07:38 GMT):
Any previous version that supports log level control?

nekia (Mon, 02 Mar 2020 07:14:13 GMT):
No, unfortunately. Wait for the next release, or you can use `build_docker_image.sh` to build your own container image. If you push it to your docker hub repo, you'll be able to refer it from your swarm environment on gcp.

nekia (Sun, 08 Mar 2020 03:17:11 GMT):
``` [2020-03-07T16:36:15.289] [ERROR] main - { Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::8080 ``` 8080 port seems to be in use. I think you need to make sure that any explorers have not been executed by ruuning `./stop.sh` or `lsof -i :8080` @Suarez 3

nekia (Sun, 08 Mar 2020 03:17:11 GMT):

javapriyan (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:18:04 GMT):
I am running explorer via docker-compose and works like a charm. But it doesn't list the installed chaincodes. I am running the latest HL image and underlaying 2.0 network

metadata (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:44:10 GMT):
I think `2.0` is still not supported by `explorer`. As per the docs, till `1.4.4` is supported. Also, the `digest(sha256 hash)` of `explorer:1.0.0-rc2` and `explorer:latest` images is same. hence both the images are same.

javapriyan (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:46:02 GMT):
Oh. The beauty is it supports rest of the page/features. Just that unable to display the installed chaincode.

javapriyan (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:46:24 GMT):
Does this uses the node SDK to fetch the information ?

metadata (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:48:53 GMT):
1. I guess it is because the major change between `1.4.4` and `2.0` is in the chaincode part only. 2. I don't think explorer depends on any sdk because I'm using `sdk-go` and `sdk-node` is not even installed on my machine.

javapriyan (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:52:49 GMT):
Thanks, Any idea on how to debug this scenario then ?

javapriyan (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 07:52:49 GMT):
Thanks, Any idea on how to debug this scenario?

metadata (Wed, 11 Mar 2020 08:00:28 GMT):
I think the only solution u have is to downgrade the fabric to 1.4.4 OR wait for new release. u can share the explorer logs here, I hope someone would help.

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 10:58:03 GMT):
Hello all, I need some help regarding explorer. whenever I'm opening explorer,it ask for username/password(login page). I can write any username/password and it works. I want to restrict it to single username/password. I tried to enable `authentication` in config.json file but it is not working. I'm using docker-compose and I'm not using CA with my network setup. **config.json** ``` { "network-configs": { "testchain-network": { "name": "testchain-network", "profile": "./connection-profile/testchain-network.json", "enableAuthentication": true } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" } ``` **explorerconfig.json** ``` { "persistence": "postgreSQL", "platforms": ["fabric"], "postgreSQL": { "host": "127.0.0.1", "port": "5432", "database": "fabricexplorer", "username": "hppoc", "passwd": "password" }, "sync": { "type": "local", "platform": "fabric", "blocksSyncTime": "1" }, "jwt": { "secret": "a secret string", "expiresIn": "2 days" } }```

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 10:58:03 GMT):
Hello @nekia , I need some help regarding explorer. whenever I'm opening explorer,it ask for username/password(login page). I can write any username/password and it works. I want to restrict it to single username/password. I tried to enable `authentication` in config.json file but it is not working. I'm using docker-compose and I'm not using CA with my network setup. **config.json** ``` { "network-configs": { "testchain-network": { "name": "testchain-network", "profile": "./connection-profile/testchain-network.json", "enableAuthentication": true } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" } ``` **explorerconfig.json** ``` { "persistence": "postgreSQL", "platforms": ["fabric"], "postgreSQL": { "host": "127.0.0.1", "port": "5432", "database": "fabricexplorer", "username": "hppoc", "passwd": "password" }, "sync": { "type": "local", "platform": "fabric", "blocksSyncTime": "1" }, "jwt": { "secret": "a secret string", "expiresIn": "2 days" } }```

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 10:58:03 GMT):
Hello @nekia , I need some help regarding explorer. whenever I'm opening explorer in browser using `http://localhost:8090`, it ask for username/password(login page). I can write any username/password and it works. I want to restrict it to single username/password. I tried to enable `authentication` in config.json file but it is not working. I'm using docker-compose and I'm not using CA with my network setup. **config.json** ``` { "network-configs": { "testchain-network": { "name": "testchain-network", "profile": "./connection-profile/testchain-network.json", "enableAuthentication": true } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" } ``` **explorerconfig.json** ``` { "persistence": "postgreSQL", "platforms": ["fabric"], "postgreSQL": { "host": "127.0.0.1", "port": "5432", "database": "fabricexplorer", "username": "hppoc", "passwd": "password" }, "sync": { "type": "local", "platform": "fabric", "blocksSyncTime": "1" }, "jwt": { "secret": "a secret string", "expiresIn": "2 days" } }```

nekia (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 11:46:36 GMT):
You need to set `true` to `enableAuthentication` in `testchain-network.json`, not config.json @Psingh

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 11:48:15 GMT):
OK. I'll try and ping u.

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 11:48:15 GMT):
OK. I'll try and ping u back.

Psingh (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 12:04:41 GMT):
Thanks a lot @nekia it's working fine :)

nekia (Fri, 13 Mar 2020 12:11:13 GMT):
:thumbsup:

nekia (Mon, 16 Mar 2020 05:32:55 GMT):
Explorer uses `sdk-node` to access fabric network. Currently we are waiting for the official release of `sdk-node` for HLF 2.0.

metadata (Mon, 16 Mar 2020 06:24:27 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 16 Mar 2020 07:05:29 GMT):
During the intense CPU usage, can you get log from explorer containers? `docker cp explorer_explorer.1.smsifbhr0q0mg4zs30eaw29hm:/opt/logs .`

nekia (Tue, 17 Mar 2020 07:27:25 GMT):
That's fine. Console log is redirected to stdout. So console dir is not generated in docker environment.

nekia (Tue, 07 Apr 2020 10:24:12 GMT):
@jona-sc @Diegoescalonaro @easeev In v1.0.0-rc3, the multi-org feature got supported. If you still have any interests with the feature in your use cases, it might be useful for you. And we would be happy if you give us any feedbacks.

jona-sc (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:22:09 GMT):
@nekia That's great to hear. Do you have a short summary of how the feature works?

nekia (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:46:58 GMT):
Thanks for your response. We don't have any document yet, but it's straightforward. Please prepare config.json as below and connection profile for each org.

nekia (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:47:20 GMT):
```json { "network-configs": { "org1-network": { "name": "org1-network", "profile": "./connection-profile/org1-network.json" }, "org2-network": { "name": "org2-network", "profile": "./connection-profile/org2-network.json" } }, "license": "Apache-2.0" } ```

nekia (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:48:25 GMT):
We'll add a short steps how to use the multi-org feature in Explorer document.

nekia (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:49:26 GMT):
@jona-sc

jona-sc (Wed, 08 Apr 2020 03:54:22 GMT):
Thanks

nekia (Fri, 17 Apr 2020 09:29:53 GMT):
Iroha integration just started in the last couple of months and we're really excited about the expansion of support for platform in Explorer. But that's also true that we haven't have enough resources for moving further the implementation at this moment. So we are always welcoming a new contribution.

uallknowmatt (Fri, 24 Apr 2020 18:56:34 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

uallknowmatt (Fri, 24 Apr 2020 18:56:35 GMT):
does hyperledger explorer work with fabric 2.0

uallknowmatt (Fri, 24 Apr 2020 18:56:59 GMT):
which version of explorer will work with fabric 2.0

nekia (Mon, 27 Apr 2020 02:27:20 GMT):
We've not supported fabric 2.x yet. The work item is currently pending until official releas of fabric-sdk-node which explorer is depending on. But even after the release we may not be able to provide support of fabric 2.x quickly because most of administrative API (such as querying of channel, chaincode, etc.) in fabric-sdk-node have been obsoleted in the latest version. @uallknowmatt

SuneetBendre (Wed, 29 Apr 2020 11:50:04 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

sigma67 (Wed, 29 Apr 2020 13:15:57 GMT):
You can run it and connect it with Fabric 2.0 just fine, just the chaincode view won't show any chaincodes

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:00:57 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:00:58 GMT):
Hello,

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:01:16 GMT):
I am trying to setup hyperledger explorer for fabric 1.4 version

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:01:33 GMT):
I have 6 orgs and 1 peer per orgs network

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:02:05 GMT):
but after setting the explorer I am getting only one node and 1 peer. I should get all the nodes and peers in the dashboard.

DimpleKanwar (Mon, 04 May 2020 11:02:25 GMT):
But I am not getting that. Can anyone tell me how to fix this?

nekia (Tue, 05 May 2020 12:08:43 GMT):
Explorer is using service discovery to detect peers. Each peer you want to see on the dashboard need to be configured with EXTERNAL_ENDPOINT setting https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-2.0/discovery-overview.html#how-service-discovery-works-in-fabric

nekia (Tue, 05 May 2020 12:09:21 GMT):
Do you have this kind of setting on each peer? @DimpleKanwar

SharedMocha (Thu, 07 May 2020 19:59:18 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

SharedMocha (Thu, 07 May 2020 19:59:30 GMT):
Hi - is it possible to create channels, deploy go, js chain codes, and instantiate from explorer on 1.4? As per this defect, I don't think it is possible, but wanted to confirm -https://jira.hyperledger.org/projects/BE/issues/BE-268?filter=allopenissues

SharedMocha (Thu, 07 May 2020 19:59:30 GMT):
Hi - is it possible to create channels, deploy go, js chain codes, and instantiate from explorer on 1.4? As per this defect, I don't think it is possible but wanted to confirm -https://jira.hyperledger.org/projects/BE/issues/BE-268?filter=allopenissues. If not possible are there any plans to add it in the future?

I am tried to find a way to specify in a config but couldn't find a way, did I miss it or the explorer simply doesn't support subpaths ?

AbdullahJoyia (Fri, 15 May 2020 21:52:46 GMT):

nekia (Sun, 17 May 2020 02:23:40 GMT):
Hi @BancuStefan I could recreate your issue on my local, too. The following info might be useful for the issue. In my local, although still I see an error message regarding websocket in console on browser, explorer dashboard has been shown with using a subdomain.

nekia (Sun, 17 May 2020 02:23:55 GMT):
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47017142/reverse-proxy-nginx-no-such-file-or-directory

nekia (Sun, 17 May 2020 02:57:42 GMT):
Explorer isn't fetch any log from fabric peers. It's just collecting logs of the node.js middleware itself. https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/app/common/helper.js

garunkumar450 (Sun, 17 May 2020 20:06:13 GMT):

Explorer doesn't have that kind of config option. nginx will be able to handle the use case without any changes to Explorer, I think.

ravinayag (Fri, 22 May 2020 10:36:23 GMT):
Did anyone faced this problem.. ?

nekia (Sat, 23 May 2020 02:06:50 GMT):
@ravinayag In some architectures, there seem to be a segmentation fault issue in the latest v1.0.0 container image. We've already fixed it on the latest master branch, but not released it on Docker Hub yet. Please build Explorer container image by yourself by using [build_docker_image.sh](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/update-v2/build_docker_image.sh) on your local at the moment.

nekia (Sat, 23 May 2020 02:06:50 GMT):
@ravinayag In some architectures, there seem to be [a segmentation fault issue](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/commit/84f6b82a97c58c6b853652316529470a65754da8) in the latest v1.0.0 container image. We've already fixed it on the latest master branch, but not released it on Docker Hub yet. Please build Explorer container image by yourself by using [build_docker_image.sh](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/update-v2/build_docker_image.sh) on your local at the moment.

ravinayag (Mon, 25 May 2020 18:07:54 GMT):
@nekia thankyou , that solved my segmentation issues.

explorer-errlog.txt

nekia (Tue, 26 May 2020 09:40:15 GMT):
> message=Calling enrollment endpoint failed with error [Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:7054],

nekia (Tue, 26 May 2020 09:44:08 GMT):
I guess you are running both fabric network and explorer on same machine. You need to make explorer container join to same network with fabric network. You can specify the network in your docker-compose.yaml. https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/docker-compose.yaml#L14

nekia (Tue, 26 May 2020 09:45:32 GMT):
And also you need to rephrase all URLs in your connection profile from localhost:* to actual hostname which valid within the docker network. @ravinayag

ravinayag (Tue, 26 May 2020 15:17:50 GMT):
What kind of dump i.....:( . Didnt realize this name conversion mistake, thats the good catch.

ravinayag (Tue, 26 May 2020 15:38:13 GMT):
After changing hostname (fqdn) docker image was able run with no errors. @nekia Thank you for your help. ( Happy to share Thank you points)

nekia (Tue, 02 Jun 2020 05:46:34 GMT):
Currently you can't specify flexibly any locations where your credentials are stored. Explorer is referring hard coded location ( `./wallet` ) when loading admin identity in bootup of middle layer. And the function for multiple users to login to dashboard has been incomplete yet.

sam94 (Wed, 10 Jun 2020 12:36:05 GMT):
Has joined the channel.

sam94 (Wed, 10 Jun 2020 12:36:06 GMT):
Hi everyone, can someone explain me how to link hyperledger explorer with mutual TLS in fabric please?

sam94 (Wed, 10 Jun 2020 12:37:52 GMT):
I managed to use it without mutual TLS but then i can't manage to do it (i have an error "failed to verify client's certificate: unknown authority server but i don't know how to specify it in the JSON)

nekia (Fri, 12 Jun 2020 14:39:25 GMT):
@sam94 Which version of explorer are you using? We tested connectivity of Explorer with mutual TLS before and it worked at that time.

nekia (Fri, 12 Jun 2020 14:43:57 GMT):
Log of the test is below https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-568 > The important configuration is adding not only msp/tlscacerts but also ca cert which is referred by fabric-ca (org*.example.com/ca/ca.org*.example.com-cert.pem) to TLS_CLIENTROOTCAS_FILES. We didn't need any changes to Explorer, you only need to setup your fabric network appropriately for mutual TLS

sam94 (Mon, 15 Jun 2020 15:15:36 GMT):
I am using the branch master, since I updated with your commit from 12th june, it works but the block event has an issue, it is trying to contact the peer without providing a certificate (error from peer logs : TLS handshake failed with error tls: client didn't provide a certificate server=PeerServer)

sam94 (Mon, 15 Jun 2020 15:22:18 GMT):
Also, to make it works I used this post: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/56774550/how-to-configure-mutual-tls-in-hyperledger-fabric (added the call of setTlsClientCertAndKey in FabricGateway/getDiscoveryResult)

sam94 (Mon, 15 Jun 2020 16:14:39 GMT):
UPDATE: it works correctly using your last commit and adding the certs in the FabricGateway/getDiscoveryResult setTlsClientCertAndKey call

selvaraman (Tue, 16 Jun 2020 17:04:33 GMT):
peer1.org1.example.com peer1.org2.example.com peer0.org1.example.com peer0.org2.example.com ca_peerOrg2 ca_peerOrg1 orderer.example.com This is what my network setup. After instantiation of my chaincode, I am getting transaction count as 0 in chaincode's tab. But It is 4 in dashboard and channel's tab. What is the reason? Can someone please explain?

nekia (Wed, 17 Jun 2020 13:23:49 GMT):
Thank you for sharing your work. We'll fix this issue based on the information you shared. Of course, always welcome your contribution as well :slight_smile:

nekia (Wed, 17 Jun 2020 13:24:02 GMT):
@sam94

nekia (Wed, 17 Jun 2020 13:28:50 GMT):
Probably gateway class of fabric-sdk-node is in charge of calling setTlsClientCertAndKey(). So user of SDK might only need to set clientTlsIdentity to option when connecting gateway.

nekia (Wed, 17 Jun 2020 13:29:06 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-sdk-node/blob/b8cc3a8f6ccca55589c60efd98b011a71eab0ea0/fabric-network/src/gateway.ts#L309

nekia (Wed, 17 Jun 2020 13:37:02 GMT):
In chaincode tab, the transaction count submitted to each chaincode are displayed. In dashboard and channel tab, not only these count, but also count of other transaction such as configuration change are displayed with added. @selvaraman

nekia (Tue, 30 Jun 2020 14:46:20 GMT):

nekia (Tue, 30 Jun 2020 14:51:05 GMT):

pleyades (Thu, 02 Jul 2020 18:14:45 GMT):
Hello team! Anyone can point me how to add users in Explorer except "admin" which define in config? When try add them via web interface - see an error: "User 'user' ror: Cannot read property 'client' of undefined"

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 00:18:57 GMT):
Thanks @ashoksiri I can see an error in log `[EventService]: on.data [peer1org1,peer0org1] - #1- unexpected deliverResponse status received - 404`

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 00:25:14 GMT):
This error message comes from fabric-sdk-node. Can you check log of each peer to see if there is any errors?

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 03:43:59 GMT):
I noticed that you make TLS disabled in your fabric network according to the connection profile you shared. Could you try to change peer URL from `grpcs://` to `grpc://`?

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 03:51:46 GMT):
@pleyades We just started working on adding multiple user management as next work item. https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-767

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 03:51:46 GMT):
@pleyades Unfortunately, it's not supported yet. We just started working on adding multiple user management as next work item. https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/BE-767

pleyades (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 06:05:35 GMT):
Got it, thank you for clarification!

pleyades (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 06:05:35 GMT):
Got it, thank you for clarification! We will wait)

ashoksiri (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 06:10:02 GMT):
in this case we have to disable the TLS ?

ashoksiri (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 06:10:17 GMT):
@nekia

nekia (Fri, 03 Jul 2020 06:37:51 GMT):
It depends on your fabric network. If you disable TLS on your network, you have to set `false` to `enableTLS` and use `grpc://` in peer url instead, in the connection profile. @ashoksiri

Apple (Fri, 10 Jul 2020 12:57:13 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 01:38:24 GMT):
Explorer used to be listing peer nodes and its status. But after adding orderers to the list, it got deleted the status from the list, because Explorer couldn't know about status of orderers dynamically.

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 01:42:18 GMT):
The followings might be help for you [PeersHealth.js](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/ed4fc5b3bfdeeacfb329a884dc7d76971440c93c/client/src/components/Lists/PeersHealth.js#L31) and [Proxy.js](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/2e57b03558a8c3e7e0c2d8f921a840d5746292a6/app/platform/fabric/Proxy.js#L125)

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 14:24:44 GMT):

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 14:24:44 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/pull/139 We're updating README now for adding more detail of each configuration. You can see its preview in the above PR. You need to configure `enableAuthentication` in your connection profile (`first-network.json`). @javiJavi

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 14:44:37 GMT):
We added the support of PEM string format in the recent commit. We've not released new container image including this change yet (we'll do within this week unless we have a big issue with the current codebase), but you can evaluate it if need.

nekia (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 15:11:35 GMT):
@Javi sorry, I misread. You're using v1.1.0 Docker image, right? In this case, you need to use old format of connection profile. ``` "client": { "adminUser": "admin", "adminPassword": "adminpw", "enableAuthentication": true, "tlsEnable": true, "organization": "Org1" }, ```

Javi (Mon, 13 Jul 2020 15:18:07 GMT):

nekia (Tue, 14 Jul 2020 06:47:05 GMT):

Javi (Thu, 16 Jul 2020 10:11:02 GMT):

admiral99 (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 09:13:00 GMT):
Hi, was just wondering if explorer supports pdc? Or might usage of pdc be the cause of differences in previous hash and block hash's?

nekia (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 13:16:12 GMT):
pdc means `private data collection`?

nekia (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 13:17:11 GMT):
explorer doesn't support pdc.

nekia (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 13:18:09 GMT):
That's because of bug that was fixed today's release.

nekia (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 13:18:20 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/pull/141

nekia (Fri, 17 Jul 2020 13:22:04 GMT):
:information_source: *v1.1.1 has been released* ## New Features * Publish new simple landing page on Github * Add another README for detail of each configuration * Add configuration for mutual TLS support * Add PEM string format support for connection profile * Add Fabric CA support to retrieve credential for admin access to fabric network ## Bug Fixes and Updates * Fix an issue of authentication * Fix an issue the targets of discovery service are always mapped to localhost * Fix calculation of block hash https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/releases/tag/v1.1.1 https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/explorer/tags 1.1.1 https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/explorer-db/tags 1.1.1 If you have any feature requests or any interests for contribution, please feel free to reach us. We would be glad. :slight_smile: Cheers

saanvijay (Mon, 20 Jul 2020 11:06:23 GMT):
Make sure your Client part looks like below... "client": { "tlsEnable": true, "caCredential": { "id": "admin", "password": "adminpw" }, "adminCredential": { "id": "exploreradmin", "password": "exploreradminpw" }, "enableAuthentication": true, "organization": "Org1MSP", "connection": { "timeout": { "peer": { "endorser": "300" }, "orderer": "300" } } },

saanvijay (Mon, 20 Jul 2020 11:07:20 GMT):
Both CaCredential and adminCredential has "id" field

nekia (Mon, 20 Jul 2020 16:08:46 GMT):
Peer url is mapped to `localhost`. I guess you're getting Explorer started as container service. The mapping shouldn't be happened in that case.

nekia (Mon, 20 Jul 2020 16:11:08 GMT):
Please make sure `DISCOVERY_AS_LOCALHOST` is defined on Explorer container service. The detail is as follow. https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/README-CONFIG.md#run-hyperledger-explorer-using-docker-compose

nekia (Mon, 20 Jul 2020 16:11:08 GMT):
Please make sure `DISCOVERY_AS_LOCALHOST` is set to `false` on Explorer container service. The detail is as follow. https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/README-CONFIG.md#run-hyperledger-explorer-using-docker-compose

sanket1211 (Fri, 24 Jul 2020 12:32:11 GMT):

Screenshot from 2020-07-24 18-01-51.png

sanket1211 (Fri, 24 Jul 2020 12:32:33 GMT):
path is correct...what could be the issue??

nekia (Fri, 24 Jul 2020 15:00:06 GMT):
You seem to specify the location of credential with host path. You need the absolute path on container like `/tmp/crypto/peerOrganizations/...`. You should specify the volume to mount the credential artifacts in your docker compose like [this entry](https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/docker-compose.yaml#L51).

nekia (Fri, 24 Jul 2020 15:00:24 GMT):
Please refer the following in detail

nekia (Fri, 24 Jul 2020 15:00:48 GMT):
https://github.com/hyperledger/blockchain-explorer/blob/master/README-CONFIG.md#run-hyperledger-explorer-using-docker-compose
